I needed more fiber in my diet and decided to try these Fiber One Oats and Chocolate Bars . They satisify my need for fiber and my love of chocolate. < br />< br /> Each bar is 1.4 ounces and provides 35 % of your daily fiber . They have 4g of fat per bar . These bars are made by General Mills . The bars are chewy and a little crunchy . They are naturally flavored . Some of the ingredients in the bar are semisweet chocolate chips , whole grain oats , barley flakes , sugarcane fiber , soy lecithin and milk. < br />< br /> This is a great value for this hard cardboard box . This is the price that I would get if I went to Sam 's Club . These bars are regularly sold in vending machines and at convenience stores . I had never tried coffee with this method . A friend of mine had a really high end model and I remember her coffee being so delicious and full of flavor . When I got this , I was n't sure of what grounds to use . I finally found some coarse grind and since then , have a coffee grinder that does a coarse grind . I have tried this with just regular coffee as well and it was n't quite the same , not the same flavor , not as strong , but it was a standard brand . The box says to steep for 3 to 4 minutes , I found 5 to be the best . I heated my water to boiling , then let it sit off the burner for about a minute , then poured a little in , stirred gently , then poured the rest of the water in . I waited 4 minutes the first time and the flavor was ok . The next batch I did 5 and much more flavor . I would definitely recommend this to someone who is wanting to try french press . I did receive this product at a discounted rate for my honest review .#### #### ####[([151], [142], 'POS'), ([99], [92], 'POS'), ([102], [98], 'POS'), ([60], [64], 'POS')]

[[ VIDEOID : d9f20ae7e2d5c0782fae6b7f47d7d36a ]] Our apartment kitchen is not very spacious . I 'm always looking into gadgets take will take less space on counter and are still useful for day-to-day basis . I came across these spice jars that attach to refrigerator or appliance in your kitchen , which means no counter space needed ! That got my interest . Here what i liked about these jars : 1 ) See through window . No need to open lid to check which spice it is . 2 ) 2 side holes on lid for pouring and sprinkling the spices 3 ) Jars are NOT made of plastic ( lids are though ) . 4 ) Holds good amount of spices . 5 ) I was impressed how strong the magnetic base is . I do n't have to worry about spice jars dropping accidentally from refrigerator / appliance . It took good force to pull it off from refrigerator . They are lightweight jars . It can be counted in pros and cons as well . Some may compare weight to quality . For me , the quality is very good for daily use and magnet is super strong . May be if it was any heavier , with spice added , it would have effected its magnetic hold . I have my most used spices in these jars now . They are so accessible . We had guests at our house , and they complimented me how creative the idea was , and how well the look blended with our refrigerator . I have n't been able to find if they are dishwasher safe . I will contact the seller and update the review . Its a very nice set . I 'm going to buy another set to gift my sister as well . **[...] I try very hard to test all features before giving my unbiased opinion to users . I have been looking for coffee equipment for travel as I just do n't want to drink hotel coffee anymore . A burr small hand grinder is the most important if you want freshly grounded coffee daily . Basically there are two designs available . One is stainless and shaped like this one and the other one is the hario mini with a hourglass shape . I got the hario mini first because I like the design and glass look better . Then I saw this product comes with a bag and I thought that is better for packing it in my luggage . After I received it here is my thought compared to the Hario mini . The grind parts ca n't completely separated like the hario mini which in my opinion is good and bad . Good thing is because it has less components , I feel it gave me a little more consistent grind . Bad thing is washing is tougher . And then while actually grinding the coffee , I feel the Hario mini actually feels better in the hand because it feels more sturdy and the shape fits better . Another issue is because the bottom of this product is snap in instead of screw in , I always feel it might come off when I am grinding . At the end , both get the job done and neither is perfect so hopeful this review can help you decide depends on what pros suit your need the most. < br />&# 34 ; I received this items at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review. &# 34 ;#### #### ####[([42], [43], 'NEU'), ([132], [138], 'NEU'), ([102], [96], 'NEU')]

I have a Deloghi Super-Auto and descale regularly when the light illuminates. . Thie frequency of descale cycles is preset through the use of a water test strip Delonghi provides with their new machines . I use delivered spring water in my machine which is surprisingly low in calcium given the source . That being said , about 2 years ago I noticed a decrease in the effectiveness of descales , as determined by a reduction in the dissolved calcium present in the discharge water . It was never a significant amount , but enough for me to see small calcium particles discharged from the machine accompanied by a sulfur smell in the water . Now I see very little come out and hardly any odor at all. < br />< br /> I wondered if perhaps it had been reformulated , so I looked on the manufacturers website and noticed a old and new MSDS sheet posted , which I believed might confirm my suspicion . I contacted the company to inquire if indeed it had been reformulated due to some EPA mandate and to ask what changed . While I learned the formula does vary by country , the person claimed there had n't been a change and also asked if I might have descaled previously with citric acid . I have n't , but apparently this can inhibit the effectiveness . I continue to use the product but am concerned of its efficacy . Other reviewers have posted favorable results . The bottled water co has n't changed its source , so I ca n't account for the difference but it 's something to watch for and time will tell. < br />< br /> For those wondering if there is a difference is between this and the bulk formula in the light grey bottle ( which seems a much better value ) there actually is . This formula does n't foam up which it works , while the other one does . The air created by the foam in the descale process is said to be detrimental to our machines , thus the reason for this Special low-suds version .#### #### ####[([38], [46], 'NEU'), ([257], [251], 'NEU'), ([83], [90], 'NEU'), ([38], [32], 'NEU'), ([42], [32], 'NEU')]

I received two different styles ( and , apparently , different builds ) of this product in exchange for my unbiased review . This is the first one I received , and it came with no instructions for use . Because I did not know the top part was supposed to be pulled up and off the see-through part in order to fill it , I only tried to do that once and it was so tightly fitted onto the cannister that I thought that must not be the way to do it . I wound up going in through the bottom of the grinder , removing the screw-on part that is used to adjust the grinder and having to take the ceramic burr grinder piece out to put salt in it . This was too aggravating for words , and then I could n't get it to grind well . I did like the flat-top styling of this grinder better than the rounded one that came a few days later . Fortunately , the tops are completely interchangeable. < br />< br /> The other version , [[ ASIN : B013S8F8I4 iKoo Battery Powered Brushed Stainless Steel body - Top button Automatic Salt , Pepper , or Spice Mill with Led light ( one pack )]] , was made better than the first one I received . Where before there had been a black plastic thumbscrew type mechanism that could be easily unscrewed , this new one had a different mechanism involving a stainless steel screw that seems more secure and well built . The instructions showed exactly how to insert batteries and fill the spice canister , so I knew the top was supposed to pull off and was n't so intimidated in trying it . With a slight loosening of the grinder screw on the bottom , my pink Himalayan salt ground up perfectly , which is really nice to have at the table . The grinder does not make much noise when grinding , which is a good thing . I was able to pull the flat-top head from the other grinder off and put it onto the newer one , and now I have a grinder I really like. < br />< br /> The product could be improved by including some kind of funnel to help pour the spice into the cannister . It is not completely open ; there is a cross bar over it , and my regular funnels do n't fit . I had to make a paper funnel to fill the grinder without spilling salt all over the place . I do n't know what the ultimate price of these grinders will wind up being & mdash ; I know a lot of vendors price things unreasonably high to keep people from buying them until they get a few last-minute kinds worked out & mdash ; but if the price stays in the $ 75 range , I would expect less plastic inside and also perhaps a funnel and a little stand to sit it in that could double as a measuring receptacle so the whole thing could sit beside the stove for cooking. < br />< br /> Finally , the four AA batteries make this grinder pretty heavy for what it does . While the shape of it is good , the weight is not . Is that much juice really needed to grind salt and peppercorns ? If one were trying to grind coffee beans in something like this ( do n't even think it ; the burrs are too small ) , I could see it.and my regular funnels do n't fit . I had to make a paper funnel to fill the grinder without spilling salt all over the place . I do n't know what the ultimate price of these grinders will wind up being & mdash ; I know a lot of vendors price things unreasonably high to keep people from buying them until they get a few last-minute kinds worked out & mdash ; but if the price stays in the $ 75 range , I would expect less plastic inside and also perhaps a funnel and a little stand to sit it in that could double as a measuring receptacle so the whole thing could sit beside the stove for cooking. < br />< br /> Finally , the four AA batteries make this grinder pretty heavy for what it does . While the shape of it is good , the weight is not . Is that much juice really needed to grind salt and peppercorns ? If one were trying to grind coffee beans in something like this ( do n't even think it ; the burrs are too small ) , I could see it .#### #### ####[([255], [260], 'POS'), ([308], [300], 'POS'), ([256], [254], 'POS'), ([251], [246], 'POS')]

I love these so much !! ! The best thing I bought ! !#### #### ####[([9], [8], 'POS')]
GREAT MACHINE I HAVE BEEN USING THIS FOR YEARS#### #### ####[([1], [0], 'POS')]
Thankfully , I have n't had the plastic taste problem , so I cannot address it . However , I have noticed a few things I love and a few things I do n't like about this unit . Some have been addressed in other reviews , but are worth mentioning again. < br />< br /> Brewing with a K Cup : What surprised me most about using a K Cup in this machine was how much better the coffee was than in my Keurig . I 've owned two different Keurig Units and decided when the second unit broke down ( both lasting only about 18 months ) that I was done with them . I think the tastier cup of coffee in this unit stems from a few things : ( 1 ) The adapter puts a large hole into the side of the K Cup , rather than a small puncture ; ( 2 ) The coffee is just hotter in the end ( I 'm not sure if this is because of the brew temperature ( which I always cranked up on my Keurig units to try to get a hotter cup of coffee ) , or because the water flows out differently instead of through a tiny hole giving it more chance of cooling ) . More of the flavors of the coffees I 've used are noticeable in this machine , with the subtle flavors really exploding . The flavors are all just bolder from this machine using a K-Cup . That said , it is a little messier to use a K Cup . You have to push the K cup into the unit to rip open the bottom of the cup , rather than just set it into place and it all happens when you close the lid . After that , you place the K Cup holder into the machine and push down the handle to pop the top . So there is a two step process for this , but it is n't difficult . Sadly , after brewing , the K Cup is REALLY hot . There 's hot water all over the top of the K Cup unit as well , so if you have sensitive hands , you 'll have to wait a bit for the unit to cool or use some tool to remove the K Cup after brewing . I 'm a bit nuts about wanting to pull them out right away and dispose of them , but now I just leave it for a while to cool . The water will drip out when you pull the K Cup unit out of the machine . You should also note that you wo n't have the fast cup of joe you may be used to with the Keurig . This machine takes a while before it actually starts brewing , not only to heat the water , but it just seems slower in the brew process as well . I 'll sacrifice that speed for the better cup of coffee any day . As some mentioned , the burner gets hot on the carafe side , even when only brewing on the cup side . The water reservoir is really annoying . You have to put the amount of water you want in the reservoir for each brew . There are markers on the reservoir for a K cup brew , a single cup brew and the carafe brew . There is only one reservoir , not two separate ones for this , so the machine brews however much water you have in the unit . There is n't a cut off switch . Be cautious not to overflow your cup . Like most have mentioned , I 've been filling the reservoir with the cup I intend to use for my coffee . This is fine until I decide I want a second cup after all ( which is uncommon ) and have a dirty cup. < br />< br /> I have not yet tried a single cup using the gold basket , but I imagine the experience is similar to the K cup. < br />< br /> Brewing on the carafe side : This is pretty standard fare . The coffee is hot and tasty . I have n't used a standard percolator coffee pot for a carafe in ages , so it 's hard for me to compare this to other models on the market. < br />< br /> In the end , the big selling point of this machine is its diversity in brewing . I 'd often get irritated having only a Keurig and then finding myself with a house full of people wanting coffee ... one cup at a time and with expensive K Cups or messy and difficult reusable K cups . The flexible brewing options are wonderful to have , but the limitations on the ability to cut off the water supply are certainly noteworthy .#### #### ####[([131], [140], 'POS'), ([225], [222], 'POS'), ([121], [120], 'POS'), ([148], [153], 'POS'), ([225], [233], 'POS')]
So much better than &# 34 ; nonstick &# 34 ; products . These Lodge products outlast them all without toxic chemicals .#### #### ####[([14], [20], 'POS'), ([11], [20], 'POS'), ([21], [20], 'POS')]
I 've only used this blender for gazpacho , and for smoothies that do include frozen fruit . So far I haven / t tried it for crushing ice cubes . Attempting to vegetables left them very uneven , it would n't replace a food processor , better improve my knife technique . The feature that sold me was the glass jar , plastic never stays so sparkling clean . Four stars for working well with basic uses , no fifth star because it really is n't a food chopper as claimed and because the jar sits loosely in the base instead of going firmly into place , which is disconcerting .#### #### ####[([44], [37], 'POS'), ([61], [68], 'POS'), ([77], [76], 'POS'), ([33], [37], 'POS'), ([77], [68], 'POS')]

Let me first say , that I almost never leave a review that ’s positive , because I think something is SUPPOSED to work as described , and that does n’t warrant a pat on the head , so when something does what it ’s supposed to I pretty much just move on with my life . Things should n’t require modification or repair to do what the manufacturer claims it is supposed to do right out of the box . Having that been said , I just abused the crap out of this thing and it beat me . You guys like popcorn , I LOVE popcorn ( Pizza , Beer , Popcorn and a good movie do n’t always require a date as far as I ’m concerned ; almost just as great all by itself ) . No , I do n’t plan to live to be 46 , but I also rarely indulge in any of the above ( though , those days might be over now ).< br />< br /> Construction < br /> I miss real Stainless Steel . Farberware is mostly crap now , and almost nothing you buy for under $ 20 is worth the trip to the store ( I ’m talking about one single chef ’s knife , et cetera ; not a set ) . The reason is because there are actually MANY grades of stainless steel ( regardless of what you are making out of it ) and you can CLAIM something is stainless in your advertising EVEN if you use the absolute cheapest grade available . There are items made of grades of stainless that will rust just sitting on a shelf in its packaging , or because of the humidity in the air . Wal-Mart sells a lot of them . However , one thing that Wal-mart does sell is a brand called Tramontina , that is actually a Brazilian Company , and they make their pots like they make their bikini models . Multi-layered bottom ! REAL stainless Steel . I ’ve soaked knives in soapy water for a week in one before ( got busy / stuff came up ) . The knives were done , and the water was rust brown , but the POT was fine ; just had to wash it out – it was like rust would n’t stick to it … THAT’S REAL STAINLESS STEEL !+< br />< br /> I would n’t doubt it at all if the pot portion of this was actually sublet to Tramontina for production ; it ’s built that well . I expected thin sheet metal . One layer ; the kind that everything burns too . The thick bottomed pot you get alone is worth the item price . You can probably use it for a ton of different other things by itself , and it will probably outlast the top / mechanism ( which I also suspect is actually made out of a good grade of Stainless – garbage stainless often comes out of the box with little rust specks in corners of parts , and this is pretty perfect so far ).< br />< br /> Oh , and if you have n’t already heard , MAKE SURE YOU GET THE MODEL WITH METAL GEARS !!!< br />< br /> Delivery – Inside a week , and the item was very well packed. < br />< br /> Experience – First use. < br /> I just popped 8 pots in this in a row ; guys , it actually seems built to do exactly that . After “ seasoning ” the pot with olive oil , I used Orville Redenbacher 100 % Natural Popcorn ( Wal-Mart ) , Act II Buttery Popping & Topping Oil and Mighty Pop Popcorn Salt ( both from Sam ’s Club ) . Once everything warms up you can set your watch by that 5 minute time ( per instructions ) . The first batch I measured everything out and poured it in ( Kernels , Oil , and Salt in that order ) . I spun the handle a few times to mix it all up and waited . After about 3 minutes the first kernels start to pop ( I actually timed it ) , and it ’s done at right around 5 minutes ( on medium heat ) . I then dumped it into a bowl and reloaded everything , EYEBALLING the ingredients every time after that . After the first batch I looked in the pot and thought for sure all the “ stuff ” left in the pot would burn on the next run . So I decided that I would keep reloading components by eye and run it until something burned . Nothing ever did. < br />< br /> I kept the burner on medium , and just took the pot off to dump and reload . I kept pouring about the same amounts of kernels , then about the same oil / topping , and sprinkling the same amount of salt , then turning the handle to mix it up . CONSISTENTLY , Iwould wait 3 minutes and then hear the first pop ( I might have spun the handle once after mixing just to move things around once ) . After the first pop I then moderately turned the handle until I could n’t anymore ( think 1 spin for every “ One-one-thousand ” count ) . DON’T FORCE THE HANDLE ! Just take the whole thing off the stove , ( I would hover it over the burner and movie it in circles as the last kernels popped ; see the tip below ) and let it stop popping . Then reload or shut-off the stove. < br />< br /> I could have kept going , but gave up after the eighth batch . After it cooled , I wiped the pot out with paper towels , wiped down the top and stirring mechanism real good , reassembled it and placed it in a brand new Kitchen garbage bag to help keep the dust out of it . I ’m pretty retentive about cleanliness ; I hand scrub my dirty dishes thoroughly before putting them in the dishwasher ( use it as a sanitizer ) . But they claim that if you use this once a week you do n’t have to clean it out , which makes sense since you are mostly talking about steam , oil , and hard kernel shells / skin ( like an abrasive ) ever touching the cooking surface . I plan to wash it monthly because oil does go rancid after a while , but the more the oil stays on it the less likely it is to ever rust . It ’s like a cast Iron Skillet , you season it , and then you care for it a little differently than other pots & Pans. < br />< br /> A few tips < br /> Try not to over fill it because it will bind up the handle once everything pops , but if you take it off the burner once the popcorn starts coming out the lid , you probably wo n’t burn anything , you just end up with more un-popped kernels ( which you could probably actually save and try popping later , but I think that ’s a little unsanitary myself. )< br />< br /> Do n’t slide it back and forth across the burner like the old Jiffy Pop “ pie pan with a handle ” packs of popcorn you would make on the burner and that would expand into a big foil bubble as the popcorn popped . BUT , once the popcorn popping slows down , I make the same motion with the pot about an inch above the burner . This way , any kernels that were JUST about to pop , but might not have because the heat was removed , still get a little heat applied to them , but the popped popcorn does n’t get burned. < br />< br /> I ’m not excited about putting the top / mechanism through the dishwasher , but the bottom pot could basically LIVE there . Very sturdy ( think decent Wolfgang Puck / Emeril pots and pans quality – definitely not the lowest grade , but not $ 100 per piece either ).< br />< br /> One Complaint < br /> My one minor , minor gripe ; when you go to dump the popcorn , sometimes both flaps open unexpectedly and you make a mess . The bottom is heavy duty as I said above , and the first part of that is HEAVY . For its size , it takes a bit of wrist muscle to deal with this one handed , and when you go to shake out the popped popcorn you have to remember that the handle itself is attached to the TOP mechanism . The top is only attached to the bottom by two spring clips built onto the top mechanism . A third spring clip holds the one flap closed while the other flap is free to open , allowing the finished popcorn to come out and pour into a bowl . If you have to shake out the popcorn to pour it into a bowl , the bottom begins to slide off of the top . The spring clips appear to begin to slide off the bottom pan ( though it is actually the weight of the bottom pan pulling it off the top ) , and the spring clip holding the other flap moves away from the bottom pot , allowing it to release. < br />< br /> The solution is simple – either take off the top and pour the popcorn into a bowl using oven mitts ( it ’s HOT ! ) OR just using one oven mitt / pot holder , support the side of the bottom pot with one hand as you shake it with the other ( will probably better reduce wear and tear on the spring clips over time versus removing it every time ) . Not a big deal , but it could be called a flaw in the design I guess. < br />< br /> Final Word < br /> I do n’t do infomercials every time I buy something … In fact , I could probably make a living doing angry A-hole reviews of things that turn out to be crap . I bought this , it was n’t sent to me for free to review . I just had to share my experience so far because I honestly have n’t bought anything for the kitchen in a VERY long time ( at least a decade ) that I was this pleased with ! same motion with the pot about an inch above the burner . This way , any kernels that were JUST about to pop , but might not have because the heat was removed , still get a little heat applied to them , but the popped popcorn does n’t get burned. < br />< br /> I ’m not excited about putting the top / mechanism through the dishwasher , but the bottom pot could basically LIVE there . Very sturdy ( think decent Wolfgang Puck / Emeril pots and pans quality – definitely not the lowest grade , but not $ 100 per piece either ).< br />< br /> One Complaint < br /> My one minor , minor gripe ; when you go to dump the popcorn , sometimes both flaps open unexpectedly and you make a mess . The bottom is heavy duty as I said above , and the first part of that is HEAVY . For its size , it takes a bit of wrist muscle to deal with this one handed , and when you go to shake out the popped popcorn you have to remember that the handle itself is attached to the TOP mechanism . The top is only attached to the bottom by two spring clips built onto the top mechanism . A third spring clip holds the one flap closed while the other flap is free to open , allowing the finished popcorn to come out and pour into a bowl . If you have to shake out the popcorn to pour it into a bowl , the bottom begins to slide off of the top . The spring clips appear to begin to slide off the bottom pan ( though it is actually the weight of the bottom pan pulling it off the top ) , and the spring clip holding the other flap moves away from the bottom pot , allowing it to release. < br />< br /> The solution is simple – either take off the top and pour the popcorn into a bowl using oven mitts ( it ’s HOT ! ) OR just using one oven mitt / pot holder , support the side of the bottom pot with one hand as you shake it with the other ( will probably better reduce wear and tear on the spring clips over time versus removing it every time ) . Not a big deal , but it could be called a flaw in the design I guess. < br />< br /> Final Word < br /> I do n’t do infomercials every time I buy something … In fact , I could probably make a living doing angry A-hole reviews of things that turn out to be crap . I bought this , it was n’t sent to me for free to review . I just had to share my experience so far because I honestly have n’t bought anything for the kitchen in a VERY long time ( at least a decade ) that I was this pleased with !#### #### ####[([107], [116], 'POS')]

A GREAT alternative to instant coffee when our trusty Keurig or electricity is n't available . Billy 's Vegan wife here ..... I had a small salad spinner that worked okay for the daily ( or twice daily ) salad , but for the past few years , I 've grown a large garden wtj lots of greens and herbs , and needed a larger spinner to handle high volumes of basil , thyme , mint etc . I also got tired of rinsing kale and other greens in small batches or using a large washtub and colander . I decided to try this Brieftons Salad Spinner as I do n't like the kinds where you pull a handle on a string AND my little &# 34 ; push the plunger on the top &# 34 ; spinner takes a fair amount of muscle AND it is quite noisy . I really like this new larger salad spinner and here 's why :< br />< br /> Pros :< br /> 1 . Large enough for large batches ( i.e. if you had a large family to feed or a big garden to process )< br /> 2 . Handle is easy to push down and the spinner is quiet. < br /> 3 . No plunger in the center that gets in the way or your greens. < br /> 4 . Holes in the drainer basket are large enough for big chunks of dirt to come out and easier to clean than a finer mesh. < br /> 5 . Price was reasonable - the price for a competitor 's spinner at Whole Foods scared me !< br />< br /> Cons :< br /> 1 . The button you push to lock or unlock the handle for storage is very stiff . I just leave mine &# 34 ; unlocked &# 34 ; and set it on top of a high shelf for storage. < br /> 2 . It does n't seem like it spins as fast as my smaller spinner - but things still get pretty dry , to I guess that 's not really an issue < br /> 3 . The &# 34 ; brake &# 34 ; button does n't slow down the spinner very quickly and emits that plastic-on-plastic squeak . I usually do n't bother to use it . I just let it spin down while I 'm chopping or prepping something else. < br />< br /> I would definitely recommend this spinner - It 's worth making space in your cabinet .#### #### ####[([37], [36], 'POS'), ([79], [78], 'POS')]

Before microwaving , make sure to vent the plate with the pull tab first . Keeps your microwave clean from splatters . Dishwasher safe , easy clean up . I love these platetoppers . Plastic wrap is such a pain , these you just put over your plate and press down on the top for an airtight seal . Keeps your food fresher longer . It seems like every Thanksgiving , I go to check the temperature of my turkey in the oven and my thermometer either takes way too long to give me a reading or I find out that my thermometer does n't work . I wanted a thermometer that gave me a very quick and accurate temperature reading of my food so I do n't lose heat from the oven and add additional cooking time . I received this thermometer and this is my first time using a digital thermometer so I did n't know what to expect . I was very pleased with the results . I put the thermometer in my baked chicken and got a temperature reading very quickly . The probe is long enough to get the center of a thick cut of meat and does n't require you to get your hands to close to the hot food you are cooking . The thermometer comes complete with a battery installed so it is ready to use right out of the box and comes with a nice storage holder to prevent damage inside your kitchen drawers. < br />< br /> Pros :< br /> Long probe to prevent burns on hands < br /> Fast temperature display < br /> Ready to use out of the box < br /> Storage sleeve < br />< br /> Cons :< br /> Small buttons < br />< br /> I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review . In short , the Spiralizer has made all my food dreams come true . I first discovered a spiralizer when my friend invited me over and whipped up a super quick , super delicious zucchini noodle pad thai . I asked her where she bought it and she said Sur La Table . Unfortunately , I do n't live anywhere near a Sur La Table , but fortunately we live in a world where you can buy pretty much anything online. < br />< br /> I read over tons of reviews on Amazon comparing the highest and most rated countertop spiralizers ( from Spiralizer , Paderno and Palermo ) , and the combination of price ($ 6 cheaper than the next best ) and number of detailed reviews made Spiralizer 's win out . I ordered right away and was happy to receive my new appliance two days early ( that 's two more days of my life spent spiralizing )!< br />< br /> The blades are super sharp , and while the construction may not be anything glamorous , it absolutely gets the job done . It 's not too difficult to figure out , fun to use , and super simple to pull apart and clean ( just be careful on the blades ... seriously , seriously sharp ) . I 'm excited to see just how many vegetables and fruits I can cut up. < br />< br /> There 's only one drawback so far : when I was using it for the second time ( with a zucchini ) , the &# 34 ; lower handle &# 34 ; broke off . I do n't think this will really effect the function of the Spiralizer , but it was surprising because I did n't really apply all that much force . I 'm not too worried about it since there is a lifetime guarantee on parts . All in all , great purchase and I 'm incredibly happy . Spiral on , friends .#### #### ####[([125], [118], 'POS'), ([148], [145], 'POS')]

This is replacing a Laroma brand carafe ([[ ASIN : B000Q4NG88 Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated Carafe ]]) , so my comments will compare the two similar items . Both have been used exclusively for keeping coffee hot. < br />< br /> The insulation on this carafe is outstanding . While the exterior of the Laroma carafe would quickly become very warm to the touch , even though I put boiling hot water in the carafe , and it may sit for an hour or more , the exterior remains cool . This shows that the heat is being kept inside rather than leaking through. < br />< br /> But , the comments of other reviewers that this carafe pours slowly are on target . It suffers from a couple of poor design elements which cause that . Primarily it suffers from a very small top opening , only 1.5 inches across . The small opening makes it more difficult to poor the hot liquid in ( and it could be very difficult to get ice cubes in if one was using it for cold beverages ) , and it makes it necessary to turn the pot almost upside down to pour the coffee out . It is like the difference between drinking beer from a pint glass versus from a long neck bottle -- to empty the bottle one must turn it upside down . By comparison , the Laroma has an opening 2.75 inches across , a 50 % increase . As a result , the Laroma profile is more like that of a drinking glass than a beer bottle. < br />< br /> The spout is essentially an open trough . It could guide the coffee into the cup if the carafe was tilted slightly , but when turned far enough to drain the carafe the coffee just flows from the opening in the carafe without benefit of the spout . So long as one is careful it is possible to pour into the cup , but because the carafe has to be inverted directly over the cup it can cast a shadow into the cup and / or block one 's view , making it difficult to pour a full cup without overflowing . The Laroma spout is fully enclosed , like a pipe or nozzle that does a better job keeping the outflowing liquid aligned ( but that design might have problems itself if it had a narrow neck like the Oggi requiring the carafe to be inverted in order to pour ).< br />< br /> The Laroma pot had a thermometer built into the lid which was a nice feature , but since this keeps the coffee hot such a long time it is not critical to know the current temperature. < br />< br /> The Laroma carafe had the lever that opened the seal in the lid break after a couple years of use , but generally seemed to be much sturdier and better quality than this carafe . The Laroma also had a seal fail between the black plastic top portion and stainless steel base after about 6 years of use which resulted in some leakage and motivated us to replace it. < br />< br /> While this is serviceable , and as I said the insulation is excellent , it leaves a lot to be desired . For the price it is a pretty good carafe , but on balance I would have preferred to have paid a bit more to get a better designed product .#### #### ####[([75], [71], 'NEU'), ([83], [90], 'NEU'), ([214], [222], 'NEU'), ([113], [115], 'NEU'), ([293], [283], 'NEU')]

Pros : No clamping needed , easy to use and reload . nice long horns / tubes , no nylon gears < br /> Cons : welding , polishing of Stainless Steel looks a bit sloppy. < br /> Amazon Prime Day 2015 was my purchase date . I had been searching for a stuffer for a few weeks , but waited until this date to see if there were any great deals . Weston 86-0701-W Manual Vertical Sausage Stuffer , 7-Pound < br />< br /> There were n't any great deals . I did see this unit Weston 86-0701-W Manual Vertical Sausage Stuffer , 7-Pound at Amazon for $ 149.99 . I liked the idea of getting something a bit bigger than a 5 # model , since most of batches are 5 # , I wanted to make sure I was never filling twice . Since then I have had a few 12 # batches , oh well ;-)< br />< br /> First unit that arrived - The first unit that arrived turned out to be a refurbished one . it had nicks and scratches , but worked fine . I only figured it out when I went to register the product and it had a sticker on the warranty card saying it was a refurbished unit . I have bought things from Amazon before that are clearly noted as returns or refurbs . They carry the same Amazon warranties , so I have had good luck with them . But you are told right up front , that the discounted price is due to its condition . On this particular purchase there was no warning . I used it heavily that weekend and then promptly returned it . I felt slighted and cheated - bait and switch. < br />< br /> Second Unit - I then reordered the same unit from Amazon , 10 days later , same price . This one arrived brand spanking new . Full warranty etc . I have used it now 6 times for about 75 # of meat.I have made sticks , sausages and even some 1 1 / 2 &# 34 ; summer sausages. < br />< br /> The unit works fine . I have tried some one man stuffing , but the wife is a willing participant and it goes quicker with two . Could you use it alone ? Yes , but you might want to clamp it down then , it tends to slip just a bit. < br />< br /> Cranking is not too hard , but I am a big guy . I think my wife has cranked it a bit , but would not last with 20 # in one day. < br />< br /> Clean up is rather easy. < br />< br /> Negatives - there is an pressure release spring and cap on the plunger / pusher . It is fastened with a slip washer / pin ( proper name ?) that is a pain to get on and off . It must come on and off for good cleaning , but I risk gauging my fingers each time I take it on or off. < br />< br /> The first couple of times we used it , we had one point about 2 / 3 way down the hpper / bin when cranking got really hard , after a few uses we realized that one of the gear teeth from inside the cabinet had broken a bit off and was stuck in the plunger 's teeth . when i removed that , the cranking issue disappeared . However , there are a couple pieces of teeth that I can hear rattling about in the gear box now . Still works fine , but I made sure to get my warranty in on time . ( Why no online registration Weston ?).< br />< br /> Yes , it does leave a big of meat in the bend and horn / stuffing tube . We have tried adding bread to the hopper to push that through , but have ultimately just used the last meat as little patties and fried them up as a reward for the stuffing work. < br />< br /> Yes , I would recommend this project.my wife has cranked it a bit , but would not last with 20 # in one day. < br />< br /> Clean up is rather easy. < br />< br /> Negatives - there is an pressure release spring and cap on the plunger / pusher . It is fastened with a slip washer / pin ( proper name ?) that is a pain to get on and off . Just what I wanted - a sharpener which works well , stows easily in a drawer , and does not need power . I started out many years ago with a ' rat tail ' straight kitchen sharpener . It sort of worked . After two powered sharpeners I gave this a try . My knives were nothing outstanding before and after a few swipes through this device became a joy to use . Fair warning - if your knives are really dull , you may want to first give them a few passes through a powered sharpener to get a starter edge . After that , put it away . This tool should be used regularly for maintaining that perfect edge - it only takes two or three swipes with light pressure to keep the edge . Now my knife practically falls through onions being diced and soft tomatoes are not a problem . I cut myself once and learned - it leaves a very sharp edge . The bottom is padded and can be used on any surface . This thing is a keeper .#### #### ####[([21], [26], 'POS'), ([140], [148], 'POS'), ([64], [58], 'POS')]

I have been a neat freak most of my life and I remember one of my biggest issues as a child was the Tupperware ® cabinet at my mothers house . It seemed like there was never a matching lid and always a mess looking for one . This product really does solve that problem . The lids snap nicely on top of each other and the bottoms of the containers also snap onto the top of the lid . That solves 2 problems at once . The first is easy and clean storage , second it makes it easy to not loose the lid when you take it off especially if you are the type to carry lunch to work or any other reason you might take them out of your home. < br />< br /> I use these both at home and in a professional kitchen for many types of food storage and easy organization . After one year of using the same few sets I purchased at the same time I am still very satisfied with the product . One problem I had with a similar product before finding this set was the lids or bottom of the container would loose their ability to snap together . I figure from the plastic wearing down or getting misshaped for whatever reason . To date that has not been a problem . One thing I would warn you of is microwaving food in these containers does not seem to be a great idea . I have noticed that the plastic will stain from it , seems to almost melt a little . I realize they claim to be microwave safe but I have had problems with that . I can honestly say this is the best set of food storage containers I have come across in both my personal and a long professional career in the restaurant business . I would easily recommend this product to anyone looking for a solution to their messy cupboards or who are tired of not having a lid to match their food storage containers .#### #### ####[([157], [147], 'POS'), ([23], [16], 'POS'), ([9], [4], 'POS'), ([157], [150], 'POS'), ([173], [178], 'POS')]

I have two mashers in my kitchen and neither are ideal or much to look at . Both have short rubber handles , one with a metal rod that curves back and forth and the other uses a plastic grid . The metal one leaves big chunks and makes you work to get a smooth consistency , the other is a pain to clean. < br />< br /> The Mexican Kitchen masher on the other hand looks refined , uses silicon for a good grip , wood for style and strength , and metal for the business end . The L-shaped design lets you push down straight to get some &# 34 ; oomph &# 34 ; or a rocking motion to work whatever you 're mashing to a smooth texture . It 's tall , giving you leverage and allowing you to store it in an utensil container ( if not , you can hang it from a hook ) .#### #### ####[([20], [19], 'POS'), ([139], [130], 'POS'), ([39], [35], 'POS'), ([72], [70], 'POS')]

I love this thing ! Replaced my flat wooden tray that had edges all around with this tray . It is Very sturdy . The legs are angled outward till they come to a stop . They however do not ' lock ' into position ( which would have been nice ) , this can cause the tray to collapse if you push on it sideways to much without supporting the legs with your hands first . This has not been a problem with me I think because the legs are between my legs preventing too much movement left or right . The height of the legs are adjustable and lock with the turn of a small knob on each side of the leg for a total of four locking knobs . Now , from the underside of the tray to the minimum set height it is about 7 inches clearance , with the legs fully extended you get about 10 1 / 2 inches clearance . I have mine set at about 8 inches and it is very comfortable . So far I have used this in bed with my laptop or while eating . No issues with the laptop . The table has 5 easily and sturdy adjustment angles from approximately 20 degrees ( lowest angled setting ) to about a 35 degree angle . When I have food items on the tray ( flat ) , cups , plates etc , they tend to slide easily on the slick lacquered wood . Have n't had a use for the drawer yet , but I do push it back in often when I lift the tray from the opposite side . It has a stop on it from coming out completely . Why they did n't do this with the drawer in is any ones guess .#### #### ####[([286], [280], 'POS'), ([214], [208], 'POS'), ([209], [208], 'POS'), ([259], [251], 'POS'), ([113], [108], 'POS')]

The easiest method of making cold brew coffee I 've encountered . Cleanup is quick , the coffee is great . I learned pretty quickly that the top of the bag is tapered to a size that nicely fits around the mouth of a mason jar , which makes it really easy to get coffee on . I usually fill the jar when the sock is still around the mouth ( 1 cup to 3 cups , coffee to water ) , just to ensure the grounds get an even bloom before I let it steep ( 18-ish hours ).< br />< br /> I 'm reading a few other reviews on here , and wanted to speak to them : first , the glass ring is , well , glass . Nice aesthetic touch , but could definitely break . I 'm being carful with it for sure . Second , this does n't make a weak batch of cold brew . If it did , it 's because the user either did n't ( 1 ) bloom the coffee , ( 2 ) let it steep long enough , or ( 3 ) used too much water and not enough coffee. < br />< br /> In conclusion , compared to a bigger and bulkier cold brew apparatus , this thing is super simple , taking up far less space in the cabinet . Cleanup is a snap , coffee is delicious . Highly recommend .#### #### ####[([6], [14], 'POS'), ([209], [214], 'POS'), ([222], [216], 'POS'), ([161], [160], 'POS')]

This is a very handy product . I have been using a Fagor pressure cooker for quite a while now and am very happy with the two-pot Fagor set I purchased from Amazon after seeing a very positive review in Cooks Illustrated . I wanted to get a new slow cooker and ran into this item - perhaps it was a daily special on Amazon . I have only had it a few weeks but so far it works great . The saute function allows you to cook onions , celery , garlic and carrots in the pot before adding the main ingredients which you can then slow cook or pressure cook as you prefer . You can choose medium or high pressure and you have three heat choices for sauteing and slow cooking . It has several programmed settings which I will learn to use. < br />< br /> As a pressure cooker it has several advantages over the stove-top Fagor. . The main advantage is that you do n't have to stick around the stove while it comes to pressure . You just get the contents ready , select high or low pressure and the time to cook and it does the rest . When the set time is done , it reduces the pressure and goes into keep-warm mode . All of the functions can be halted and different functions started. < br />< br /> It seems to work fine ans a pressure cooker , slow cooker , or rice cooker . Clean-up is a snap as the stainless steel cooking pot slips right out of the cooker and cleans up easily including in the dishwasher . The remaining part of the cooker stays clean and dry and needs almost no care .#### #### ####[([255], [263], 'POS'), ([260], [250], 'POS'), ([5], [4], 'POS'), ([128], [132], 'POS'), ([32], [23], 'POS')]

I bought 2 from Walmart ( trying to save money ) but they would leak when lifted to the lips . I would just wrap a paper towel around the lid in order to absorb the liquid . Cue the LifeSky Coffee Mug ! First , the seal is super tight ! I have n't had an issue with leakage . It has a lock feature that keeps the lid secured to the canister . Next , the inner lid has a rubber component that also secured the lid to itself . Finally , the entire canister is BPA free and holds 16 oz ( or 2 cups ) liquid . The handles on these scissors look in the photo to be designed ergonomically . However , the design actually makes them very difficult to hold and operate . There is an oval handle and a flattened oval side . For a right handed user the thumb would normally go in the flattened oval side and the index finger in the oval side . My thumb does not fit in the flattened oval side . These scissors have a top and bottom so they cannot be flipped over to resolve this issue . All that being said , maybe they are great for left handed users .#### #### ####[([53], [51], 'NEU'), ([32], [31], 'NEU'), ([37], [35], 'NEU'), ([32], [41], 'NEU'), ([45], [51], 'NEU')]

As a wine collector of 40 years or so , I 've tried every label removal technique - and I mean everything - heating bottles in the oven , soaking them in hot water , that weird scraper gadget - and as a general rule , for all bottles since 1985 , these label lifters are the way to go . ( For bottles older than 1985 - if you 're lucky enough to still have some - a soak in hot water works the best . I do n't know what happened in ' 86 - perhaps the label adhesives improved - but older labels come right off in hot water , and newer ones do not. )< br />< br /> I agree with other reviewers that the product is expensive , for what amounts to a wide piece of packing tape - but the price has decreased recently . I disagree with those who say you have to wait 2 hours , or 2 days ( really ?) after application . Waiting does n't help . What helps is pressure , with whatever blunt utensil you have handy , and then CAREFUL lifting of one edge while keeping your thumbs firmly pressed on the label . It takes a bit of practice , so do n't be discouraged if you wreck the first label or two . ( Practice on some cheapo bottles before trying to lift that 2000 Lafite label , please ! ) If a hole begins to develop , press that section back down , apply more pressure , and try again . If it still wo n't come up , insert a box cutter blade just behind the area that wo n't adhere to the tape , apply more pressure , and try again . As a last resort , start over from the other side of the label . If you know from past experience that a label will be stubborn , soak it in hot water and let it dry thoroughly before applying the lifter . Remember , once you 've applied it , there is no going back - you ca n't take it off and start over . Happy label collecting !#### #### ####[([82], [85], 'POS')]
It was a bit challenging to find stainless steel funnels , and plastic just would n't work for our application . This set is just perfect .#### #### ####[([3], [4], 'POS'), ([8], [4], 'POS'), ([3], [7], 'POS')]

If you bought a Brikka before Sept 2011 , these are the gaskets for you . The old design requires TWO gaskets , one at the filter , and one around the funnel itself . So this replacement pack comes with two filter gaskets , one filter , and one funnel gasket . It appears Bialetti USA no longer stocks these parts , and you ca n't even buy them directly from them . Even their customer support does n't know about the old model ... they just throw their hands up in the air and tell you to buy a new model . Shame on you Bialetti !< br />< br /> If you bought a Brikka after Sept 2011 , then it uses standard size gaskets . You can tell if you have a new version , because it has a hole in the lid , and the water fill line is in the top half of the unit instead of in the lower pot itself . If you have a new style Brikka , then the 2-cup shares the same gasket as a standard 3-cup Moka express , and the 4-cup share the same gasket as a 6-cup Moka express. < br />< br /> However , depending on how often you use your Brikka , you could buy a new model Brikka for the cost of three of these replacement part packs ( currently selling for $ 18 / set ) . Choose wisely !< br />< br /> I rate this three stars begrudgingly , because I have an old style Brikka and feel that Bialetti shafted us early adopters by not providing continued support with replacement parts . At least they 're still available through other venues , albeit at a premium .#### #### ####[([257], [264], 'NEU'), ([104], [101], 'NEU')]

I had previously heard of whiskey stones before , but I always associated them with only whiskey . I do n't drink whiskey so I never picked any up . I saw some reviewers mention using these for other drinks and then I realized how handy these could be . I drink coffee every morning , but it comes out of my Keurig a bit too hot for me , so I put an ice cube in it . I hate how the ice dilutes my coffee , but I just dealt with it . These have solved that problem . Two of them get my coffee to the perfect temp in a couple minutes ! We have used them in soda and juices and they are great. < br />< br /> I should note that these do n't work as good as ice cubes . The description sates that &# 34 ; Will not Get the Drink as Cold as Ice &# 34 ; , so that 's not a surprise . They help maintain the temp of already cold drinks , they cool room temp drinks a bit and they slightly cool hot drinks . Using more cools the drink more. < br />< br /> Not only are the amazing for cooling drinks , but they make a fun little &# 34 ; clink &# 34 ; noise in the glass . They are moderately heavy , so be careful not to let them slam against your teeth . They also look really cool in clear glasses . The case they come in is really nice and the tongs are a great little extra . These are a wonderful gift idea . All my friends know that when I go to restaurants and get my rare Diet Coke , I always get it without ice because I HATE it being watered down . This would be the perfect gift for someone like me . I highly recommend this set because it works good and looks really cool ! I was sent this to test and review . That has no bearing on my rating or review of it , this is my honest opinion .#### #### ####[([145], [142], 'POS'), ([272], [275], 'POS'), ([283], [276], 'POS'), ([113], [109], 'POS'), ([196], [199], 'POS')]

My grilling routine was missing something , but I did n't know what that might be ... until I received this basting brush and cup . Up until now I 've only used that basting tool that looks like a mini mop . You know the one I mean . It soaks up a lot of sauce or marinade or whatever , and you can really slather all over the meat on the grill with it , but cleaning it is a nightmare . I 've never really trusted that it was completely clean , and not still harboring germs and bacteria and such . Well , after trying this new stainless steel basting brush , I can finally throw away that old &# 34 ; mop &# 34 ; baster !< br />< br /> This basting brush has a nice long handle for reaching deep into the grill if necessary . Silicone bristles means it will pick up and hold a good deal of whatever you 're basting with , but also makes clean-up a breeze . I love the little folding basting cup which is made of silicone too . Silicone is so easy to use , heat resistant , and cleans up fast , so you could move from barbeque sauce to melted butter simply by swishing both cup and brush in hot sudsy water , rinsing well , and letting air dry . Simple as that . The handy storage bag that 's included means you can keep the brush and cup together when not in use . I will probably keep this with my grilling tools , but the brush and cup would be useful in the kitchen too . I like to brush melted butter on the tops of my biscuits , and that would be easy to do with this set . The silicone cup wo n't transfer heat from whatever 's inside it , making it ideal for basting with hot or warm liquids . And the cup is collapsible , which means it does n't take up unnecessary room. < br />< br /> A great grilling set and useful in the kitchen too . Would also make a great gift !#### #### ####[([137], [142], 'POS'), ([244], [238], 'POS'), ([222], [227], 'POS')]

Tea leaves are n't meant to steep indefinitely , but by the time you can actually drink it ( yes , it does a GREAT job of keeping liquids warm !) , even the lightest teas are dark and acidic . I am switching from steel knives to ceramic in my camping kit , and decided on this paring knife. < br /> The rubberized handle makes it easy to wash , capable of soaking , and the ceramic blade keeps it constantly sharp , impervious to rust and light weight . This knife comes with a little blade cover that fits extremely snug - no accidental falling off on this one. < br />< br /> The paring knife cuts well . It 's definitely sharper than cheaper steel knives , but is missing that ' extreme ' edge compared to higher quality steel knives . That said , it 's lightweight , compact and does not require sharpening . It 's been used to cut fruit , carve hotdogs , spear food and do light-weight cutting chores around camp . Stays sharp . We dropped it once while the blade cover was on onto some rocks by accident , and the knife suffered no damage . While they say not to handle dropped ceramic knives , I have n't had any issues using it since then . YMMV . ( Dropped ceramic knives can have structurally compromised integrity , meaning the knife could shatter during the next use , so be careful !)< br />< br /> Compared to a ceramic santoku I own , the knive really is much duller , and the sharpening shows that the knife was sharpened in segments , not in one go . So I imagine the sharpened edge is not uniformly sharp . For this I 've removed a star , but as a simple , no frills and easy to clean paring knife with decent durability , it 's a solid cutter and a good introduction into showing the potential of ceramic knives . Had I not already had a santoku of extremely good quality , I would likely have rated this five stars. < br />< br /> I was given a discount for this item in exchange for an unbiased review .#### #### ####[([175], [174], 'POS'), ([52], [56], 'POS'), ([89], [87], 'POS'), ([46], [42], 'POS'), ([89], [85], 'POS')]

I 'm in love with this machine . I 'm a first time Keurig user and I cannot get enough of this Keurig 2.0 K350 brewer . I honestly do not understand the negative buzz around the 2.0 machines . I 've read various complaints mostly specifically about having to use pods specifically approved by Keurig for the machine to work , however , from a financial perspective , it is saving me money . With $ 12 I can purchase a pack of 16 K-cups , which is equivalent to about 75 cents per 8oz cup of coffee , meanwhile a 12oz bag of the same brand of ground coffee will be about $ 10 and I 'll get 72 oz out of it which is about 90 cents per 8oz cup of coffee . Not a huge difference but just reiterating that I do n't understand the complaints . Furthermore , it is super convenient popping in a K-cup and hitting a button to brew my perfect cup ! It is attractive to look at , easy to clean and overall a great machine to invest in . I 've had it for about a month now and do n't have one single complaint ! Thanks , Keurig , for the free pods for this review !#### #### ####[([169], [173], 'POS'), ([25], [19], 'POS'), ([34], [33], 'POS'), ([139], [138], 'POS')]

if you enjoy cooking you have to have a cast iron in your kitchen . I was worried about using this and how to season it , but reading some articles and trying it a few times it really was n't that difficult . Here are the steps to season your cast iron :< br />< br />- Preheat the oven to 350 degrees < br />- Only during the first time wash it with soap and water using a sponge < br />- Rinse < br />- Rub vegetable oil inside and out using a towel < br />- Place in the oven for an hour < br />- Turn off the oven and leave in there until it 's cooled completely < br />< br /> After it 's seasoned the pot should only be washed with water and non-metal brush. < br />< br /> The benefits of cooking using this cast iron pot are tremendous since the pot transfers the heat evenly also you use less oil in your cooking because of the seasoning of the pot . Cooking in cast iron also increases iron in your food , which has great health benefits. < br />< br /> I use this pot in cooking in the over or over the grill as well as stove . There are a number of dishes that I 've made in this pot and I can generally say that the food comes out better tasting and love the flexibility of this pot. < br />< br /> There are some other more expensive brands out there , but I like the quality of this pot and I prefer to buy American made items .#### #### ####[([188], [195], 'POS'), ([36], [42], 'POS'), ([63], [70], 'POS'), ([170], [169], 'POS'), ([156], [158], 'POS')]

I bought this product for the price and its multiple functions . However , my experience with the product led me to believe that it is a mere 2-star product . When I first took it out of the box , I was happy to notice that the grey lining was a soft touch material which allowed me to have a much more sturdy and nice grip . What upset me , by quite a lot , was its poor construction and unacceptable finishing touches . The glue holding this grey lining extended out-and-beyond and onto the handle itself . I had to spend a good amount of time finding the right material to wash this sticky residue off the handle ( remember that was the first time I had taken it out of the box ) . Thus , first star off . After its first clean up , I proceeded to finally using the damned thing . Oh my goodness it is WEAK ! Weak . Weak . Weak . I put on the mixer attachment and stuck it into my bowl and turn it on . BARELY ANY MOVEMENT . So I decided to move it around a bit , left and right , back and forth , round and round ... still BARELY ANY MOVEMENT . I then raised my hand slightly up and WOOOSH !! ! the mixer splats my ingredients . Hmmm . Not too impressed . Thus , second star off . Lastly , the battery simply sucks . I do not know what it is about this product , but apparently even when you charge this thing for an hour , then overnight , and then some , and then some more , it still refuses to last more than merely a few minutes . Thus , third star off . I believe that there is a lot of potential in this product , but without strength and energy it is still just a step above useless .#### #### ####[([127], [126], 'NEG'), ([120], [111], 'NEG'), ([83], [82], 'NEG')]

There are many things I like about this saucepan . The size is perfect for making tea for 4 , soups , and sauces . Cleanup is easy . It comes out shiny out of the dishwasher . But there are also a few things that are super annoying . First , as one reviewer said , it tends to tip over towards the handle when empty . When you pour something in it , then it stabilizes . This is a minor inconvenience and once you know this , you can work around the limitation . Second , if you keep the lid on when heating ( as I often do ) , the lid handle gets phenomenally hot ! I have many stainless pots with lids , and steel being a poor conductor of heat , the lid handles do get warm , but not burning hot like this ! And although I 've learned to use potholders and towels when lifting the lid , my guests have often been burned . This is the one reason why I would n't recommend this pot to anyone. < br /> UPDATE 11 / 21 / 15 :< br /> After having used this saucepan for many months now , the lid getting hot has become a real deal breaker for me . I have Fisler pots too , and their lids are cool to the touch .#### #### ####[([211], [213], 'NEG'), ([207], [213], 'NEG'), ([130], [133], 'NEG'), ([231], [233], 'NEG')]

My job requires extended hotel stays and this oven ( in addition to an induction burner ) has meant that I am able to keep my usual eating habits while living in a hotel room . I wasted no time testing this mighty little oven out - immediately after setting up the oven I roasted a 3lb rack of BBQ ribs to perfection . Of course it can also be used to toast. < br />< br /> Surprisingly the baking times are a little bit longer than a conventional oven , even with the optional convection setting turned on . However , I have had no problem simply adding time and watching closely. < br />< br /> If you are measuring for a spot do keep in mind that the metal exterior gets very hot . I try to only keep small ceramic / glass items on top if I have to set things there ( it is perfect for keeping a glass / metal / ceramic dish warm . I have some mixed feelings about this Tiger Corp . Stainless Steel Travel Mug . I like its sleek , simple style , and the fact that the bottom of it is narrow enough to fit in the cup holders in all my vehicles . When the button is not pressed down , it does n't leak at all. < br />< br /> It works really well to keep drinks both hot and cold for a long time . I had hot coffee 3 hours after I filled it , though no longer burning hot , it was definitely still hot , not warm . When I used it for iced tea and ice water , I was able to refill it twice with the same set of ice. < br />< br /> However , I wish the lid were made a little differently . You can not see inside it for cleaning . You can click the button down and shake it around in the soapy hot water , and then run hot water through it , but you ca n't scrub inside it . I have to double-check that I have it facing the right direction before drinking since the edge is the same all the way around . There is n't a raised side that lets me easily drink without looking . Found that out the hard way with hot coffee. < br />< br /> And I confess I 've gotten used to a different style that self-locks between sips . I left it sitting on the counter with the button pushed down , and it got knocked over and spilled coffee all over my lesson plan . Oops !< br />< br /> Do not fill above the inner line . If you do , and then try to put the lid on , it will leak out around the seal . Also , if you do that it creates a vacuum seal inside sometimes that means you need to remove the lid and screw it on again to let you get a sip . Again , just a lesson learned the hard way. < br />< br /> I do like it but I think I 'll use it primarily for cold drinks rather than coffee . I 've just had a few too many issues with using it for coffee .#### #### ####[([28], [32], 'POS'), ([176], [169], 'POS'), ([160], [168], 'POS'), ([170], [169], 'POS'), ([296], [295], 'POS')]

I love silicone mats for both rolling out dough and for baking , and this BakeitFun mat is a great addition to my kitchen because it 's not quite like my others . It has measurements in both inches and centimeters on the edges so assist when you need to roll out dough to exact dimensions , and it has 11 printed concentric circle for piping out matching sizes of whoopee pies , macarons , meringues , or cookies . Like many but not all silicone mats , it is reinforced inside using a fiberglass mesh that also helps with even heat distribution . I encountered only two heat-scratching features of this baking mat : 1 . The manufacturer decided to place the BakeitFun logo in such a position that there 's no 12th circle , a real pain when you 're trying to make macarons or sandwich cookies . 2. The instructions say to wash in warm soapy water before first use and to coat in vegetable oil . It says that you do n't have to repeat the oil unless you wash it in the dishwasher . I 've never heard of oiling a silicone mat before , but I did go along with the instructions. < br />< br /> One of the possible downsides to cooking on silicone is that some prevent bottom browning . This one does not . In fact , the bottoms of my baked goods come out with evenly browned undersides. < br />< br /> The size is perfect for fitting inside a standard cookie sheet / jelly roll pan . It 's called a &# 34 ; half sheet &# 34 ; because it 's approximately the size of a half sheet cake. < br />< br /> I really love this baking mat for the measurements as well as the standard positive attributes of a silicone mat . I only wish the designer had taken into account a baker 's need to have an even number of circles . Note : I received a free sample for testing and review. < br />< br />-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann#### #### ####[([52], [62], 'POS'), ([123], [133], 'POS')]

Love these reusable straws . I use them for ice coffee or smoothies . They are really easy to clean - I do n't even use the included cleaning brush . The trick is not to let them sit out and dry after use with a thick smoothie . I just flush them with hot water immediately after use and put them in the dishwasher with everything else . The straws I received are exactly 8.5 &# 34 ; long with a 1 / 4 &# 34 ; diameter . I 've been using them semi-regularly for nearly a year now and they show no signs of rust or wear . This is likely due to their composition - the 18 / 10 stainless steel means they are made up of 18 % chromium and 10 % nickel , making them more resistant to corrosion . UPDATE I am still using these straws and there are absolutely zero signs of rust or corrosion . I am very impressed with them . I use them nearly daily with my morning iced coffee . Yes , even in winter , something about iced coffee that keeps me going . To this day I still have n't used the included cleaning brush . Never had the need . A quick rinse with hot soapy water and into the drying rack ! Sometimes I throw them in the dishwasher if I 'm planning to run a load but there really is n't a need for that either .#### #### ####[([213], [220], 'POS'), ([152], [142], 'POS')]

The coravin 1000 wine system is a revolutionary new gadget for wine lovers . Basically it 's an insulation system that allows you to access the wine without actually opening the bottle . The device injects argon into the bottle once it 's opened , pressurizing the contents and thus keeping it from mixing with O2 . Upon removal of the device , the cork is resealed ( im not sure how ) but it worked with the three bottles I tried it with. < br />< br /> It 's a little awkward the first time you try it but it 's really easy after one use . Keep in mind that the wine pours through the system so you will be essentially pouring your wine through a gadget which alters the experience for me in some situations ( like a romantic evening ) .#### #### ####[([96], [104], 'POS'), ([96], [93], 'POS'), ([4], [8], 'POS'), ([9], [7], 'POS'), ([11], [7], 'POS')]

I 've had a Donvier since the 80 's . I love the device and the concept probably more than the application . You do have to work fast with it or the build-up of rock-solid ice cream will make it next to impossible to move the blades . I 'm not surprised to read some have broken theirs , I 've often had to turn the blades with my hand over the center rather than the handle . It was that frozen . On the plus side , we have fresh ice cream or Italian ice most every evening . This heavy , thick , enameled dutch oven pot is perfect for making roasts and pulled pork , two of my favorite slow cooked dishes. < br />< br /> To give this an initial test run , I modified a pulled pork recipe from Ree Drummond that called for a can of adobo chiles and a can of soda , among other things . It came out great ! It cooked in here for six hours at 300 and at the end was falling apart and cooked through without burning or drying . The whole thing was moistened due to the little dots on the lid that dispersed the liquid as it steamed to the top. < br />< br /> While I like the enamel coating inside and out , which makes it easy to clean and possible to put in the dishwasher if necessary , though it 's better not to , I would have been even happier with a true cast iron dutch oven where we could benefit not only from the even heat distribution but also the health benefits of cast iron . That said , the enamel is like a healthy version of nonstick and I appreciate the easy cleanup . And the other cast iron dutch oven I have that has a cast iron interior IS harder to clean after AND cost twice as much. < br />< br /> Overall if you want the health benefits of cast iron , look elsewhere , but if you want even cooking and easy cleanup when making dishes like roasts and pulled pork , this is a very well designed and low cost dutch oven. < br />< br /> Just do n't expect many recipes from Rick Bayliss available online for using this . My search for recipes from him using a Dutch oven came up with only a couple , and the included recipe book only had one recipe using this pot . Maybe I need to buy his books ?#### #### ####[([205], [209], 'POS'), ([212], [204], 'POS')]

I was so excited to receive my new Keurig as a birthday gift , as my last one of 5 + years was on its last legs for sure . For the first few weeks , it worked just fine . I love the needle cleaner , the larger water reservoir , and the general ease of K450 . The downsides are not being able to select a hot water brew larger than 6 oz . ( I need to run it twice to fill my husbands travel mug with tea ) , not being able to use a &# 34 ; my k cup &# 34 ; for ground coffee , and the biggest issue for me has been that I am consistently getting coffee grounds in my cup . A lot of grinds , not just a few but probably close to a teaspoon ! I have used the needle cleaner almost daily since this started , have avoided brewing anything larger than the 8oz cup , and this morning finally decided to run my already brewed coffee through a french press pot to get rid of the grinds . For whatever reason , it always seems worse on the second cup of the day , and when I open the pod holder , water and grinds run all over the counter . Needless to say , I am not so happy with this coffee maker , and may have to switch back to my old and dying one , or even just a regular old coffee brewer and give up the convenience of the Keurig .#### #### ####[([194], [202], 'NEG'), ([134], [139], 'NEG')]

If you are in a group ( such as in a meeting at work , etc. ) and if you have hot liquid like coffee it in , this creates a very audible &# 34 ; pop &# 34 ; as well as a &# 34 ; click click &# 34 ; when you open it and &# 34 ; click click &# 34 ; when you close it . This draws attention to you in a group - not appropriate for a business meeting , for example. < br />< br /> The Thermos Stainless King has a different action on top that can be controlled with your thumb and is practically silent . Since it works just as well , holds the same amount , and is also slightly less tall , I much prefer it . I 'm keeping this Tumbler for a backup .#### #### ####[([65], [73], 'POS')]

I cant say enough about this cool little gadget . I ordered one for a relative with loss of strength in their hands and had a hard time working a hand can opener but does n't like the big , clunky under the counter or counter top electric can openers that take up too much cabinet space . I gave one away and kept one for myself . My eight year old daughter loves it too ! There are no sharp edges and simple enough for kids to work . It wont start until it is atop a can , so you know it wont accidentally turn on in the drawer , larger cans just require you push the button a couple times , instead of once . Basically , you set this little gadget on the car , push the button and let it go . It rotates around the can until the lid is completely cut ( may require an additional push of button for big cans ) . Then you pick it up and the lid to stuck to a magnet on the tool . The edges are not sharp on either the can or the lid . It 's pretty cool !#### #### ####[([70], [80], 'POS')]

One is n't worth much without the other. < br />< br />► Original Review Below ◄'< br />< br /> I bought [[ ASIN : B004LKVRLG Spice Lab 's Himalayan Dark Pink Coarse Crystal Salt ]] to go in the salt grinder along with multi colored pepper whole peppercorns that I liberated from these disposable grinders I bought last year ... [[ ASIN : B00275SBGQ Olde Thompson Pepper Supreme ]] and the result is a truly beautiful combination . I 'm a pretty no nonsense guy , but sometimes esthetics matter and the combination of the dark pink salt crystals with the multi-colored peppercorns inside the glass bulbs with stainless ends is absolutely beautiful. < br />< br /> The grinders work very well , but I have a few gripes that caused me to rate these 4 stars instead of 5 . The glass bulbs that hold the salt and pepper are very cheaply made and both have lines running the length of the glass . Additionally , one of the glass pieces arrived with a chip out of the rim and the broken glass sitting in the glass bulb . It 's nothing that prevented me from using the grinder , but still , it 's bad form to ship out a product that has a sliver of glass sitting inside the bowl where the customer is to put food stuffs . Luckily I saw the little sliver ; but I shudder to think of the possible implications if someone with poor eyesight had received my grinder set . My second gripe is that the lids appear identical , but when we mixed them up , one snapped in so tightly that we could barely get it back off and the other lid was so loose that it just fell off if you tipped the grinder upside down with the lid on . They should either fit exactly the same on each grinder or they should be marked with an &# 34 ; S &# 34 ; for salt and a &# 34 ; P &# 34 ; for pepper so that they are not easily confused. < br />< br /> In summation , the grinders work perfectly , and look great if loaded with the salt and pepper I linked to . I like them , and if not for the chipped glass on the one unit , they 'd be worthy of four stars . With better quality glass and the lid issue fixed , they are a five star product. < br />< br />🌟 Complimentary Product Received for Testing and Unbiased Review 🌟 and the other lid was so loose that it just fell off if you tipped the grinder upside down with the lid on . I bought this yogurt maker after doing much reading about yogurt makers and this one seemed to be rated well . I knew that yogurt is known as a healthy food due to the live bacteria in it that is good for the gut . Because the jars are so hot when I take them out of the machine , I started taking the temperature of the yogurt with my highly rated , known for its accuracy , electronic thermometer . It 's running between 130-136 degrees when I pull the jars out . From what I 've read , that 's way too hot for yogurt bacteria to live in . Pretty much defeats the purpose of making yogurt . I had extra yogurt mix when I made it last night so poured it into a large jar then wrapped it in multiple layers of towel . Guess what , I checked it after 11 hours and it worked great ! Nice yogurt without all the heat . This is my new plan . I 'd heated the milk to 200 degrees before cooling to 112 degrees to add the starter so I know the milk was well pasteurized , and the starter bacteria are supposed to keep the milk from going bad . Sometimes the old way of doing things is best !#### #### ####[([131], [130], 'NEG'), ([131], [137], 'NEG'), ([210], [213], 'NEG'), ([218], [217], 'NEG'), ([138], [137], 'NEG')]
