Very mixed feelings . I purchased two of these for my 5-year-old twins ( normal motor coordination and such ) . They are off to Kindergarten this year , and I wanted something very simple for them to use at school during lunch-time . I thought this was perfect since it only required opening one container rather than having them open tons of baggies and containers for each type of food. < br />< br /> My idea backfired a bit . The problem is that the container is VERY difficult to open , even for me . The seal on it is great ( keeps things separate and fresh ) , but because of this , it creates a strong suction when opening it and it 's near impossible for my kids to pull it open . We 've been practicing each day so they 're not totally struggling at school . It 's also incredibly hard to close . The hinges allow the lid to slide back slightly , so in order to close it you have to hold the hinges flush in the back ( or pull forward on the lid ) while pushing down on the lid at the same time. < br />< br /> It 's so unfortunate . The quality is great , it 's very durable , works perfectly holding their food . Easy to wash . Good size . I 'm just very upset it 's so hard to open and shut for a child . It defeats the purpose . Seems that a small handle or lip on the outside of the container , allowing you something to grasp while opening and closing would have helped. < br />< br /> Also ... if using for school lunch , you need to also purchase a bag for it to go into . This container has no handle so a child may have a hard time carrying to the lunch room ... also obviously need the bag to hold their drink and utensils and such . Would have been cool if it had a handle and a place a thermos could snap on or something. < br />< br /> All that said , I 'll see how it works for the first few weeks of school . I 'm hoping my kids get the hang of it , because I do like it . If I could give 3.5 stars I would .#### #### ####[([99], [90], 'POS'), ([143], [136], 'POS'), ([16], [14], 'POS'), ([216], [223], 'POS'), ([229], [223], 'POS')]
I bought this machine about a month ago and have had nothing but a positive experience from using it . I 'm a person that does their research about expensive products before buying and I just was n't sure whether or not to go for the 2.0 brewer . The main reason people did n't like it is because their k-cups were n't compatible . This is my first brewer , so any k-cups I bought were already made compatible with this brewer . I found it easier to order straight from Keurig 's website and they delivered in a decent amount of time ( I say that because I 'm used to Amazon 's 2-day prime shipping ) . I 'm a college student in a small apartment , and this was the perfect size for my counter . It does n't take up much space at all , can open up fully under my cabinets , and even has the 40oz water reservoir so I do n't have to reach back and fill it up with water every single time I want to make a cup of coffee . In addition to coffee , I 'm a fan of tea beverages and the brewing technology is awesome for this ! I never have to worry about a trace of coffee in any of my tea drinks . Overall , I 've had an awesome experience with this brewer and because I registered my brewer with Keurig online , I 'm getting a ton of incredible deals on k-cups , including rewards for writing this very review ( which did n't affect my opinion about this brewer in any way , shape , or form ) . To my shame , I have never used a zester before . I have always thought that there is n't really much difference between a ( cheese ) grater and a zester . But when I tried to zest some lemon using my cheese grater , all I ended up with was a lot of oil resulted from the zest and not as much zest , because the wholes are too small and not suitable for citrus peel . I have also used the small part of a standard grater , but again , the wholes are too small and the result is different from the one obtained with a zester. < br />< br /> This product was a pleasant surprise . I had no idea it was so easy to create lemon zest . It only takes 1-2 seconds , so you have to pay attention because the zester gets to white bitter part of the lemon very quickly . With a grater , I had to grate the same area several times to get some zest . The zester is a lot faster and the result is long beautiful shreds of lemon peel . I absolutely love the flavor of lemon and orange peel in baked goods . For Christmas and Easter I bake a sweet bread filled with walnuts , cocoa or chocolate and raisins and I always add zest to the dough . This tool will come in handy. < br />< br /> If you are using this for citrus , make sure you buy unwaxed fruit , because standard citrus fruit are coated with a layer of wax to last longer. < br />< br /> You can use this zester for garlic as well , although I recently got a garlic press , so I wo n't risk shredding my fingers. < br />< br /> I used this for Parmesan cheese and it grates the cheese very fast and as long as you have a big chunk and watch your fingers , it seems to do a better job than a grater . I have also used it to grate nutmeg and ginger . This is especially great because I could never get good results with a grater . Ginger is a very fibrous plant , so it get stuck on to the grater and it is impossible to clean . I did n't have this problem with the zester , probably because the holes are a different shape than those of a cheese grater. < br />< br /> In case you are wondering , I use grated ginger to make ginger infused water . It tastes good and it is also great for oral hygiene . I learned about it long ago when I had sensitive gums that were occasionally bleeding and rinsing with ginger water made my problem go away. < br />< br /> The product is made from stainless steel , which makes for a great quality product . The handle is plastic , but I do n't remember seeing zesters that have a handle from a different material , so I assume plastic is resistant enough for a zesting job . Remember to use a gentle detergent and non-scratch sponge when washing stainless steel utensils and dry them immediately so they do n't get stained . The zester 's teeth are very sharp , so use with caution . It comes with a protection plastic cover , which is useful , since you do n't want to get scratched when grabbing the zester out of your drawer . The product is just a bit longer than some of my utensils , but if you store it in a utensil holder or on a hook on the wall , it is not an issue. < br />< br /> I like the product and I ca n't believe I 've baked for so many years and never used a zester before . I thought it was one of those tools that you can live without , but it 's actually really useful and makes your life easier. < br />< br /> NOTE : I received this product free in exchange for my unbiased and honest review.ginger to make ginger infused water . [[ VIDEOID : e3f3c1e82c045d9eb76b33996b4362fe ]] Included with the digital thermometer are the instructions , the transmitter stand and the probe with an approximate 3 foot 2 inch cable . Two AAA batteries are required for the thermometer display and two are required for the base transmitter but not included . The instructions are basic but cover the details for use pretty well aside from a misspelling or two . There is no warranty information indicated in the instructions for this thermometer. < br />< br /> The thermometer and transmitter stand both have grey plastic casings . The thermometer is lightweight but feels fairly well made . The transmitter has a power switch on the bottom and the thermometer display has the power switch on the back . Both power switches are fairly small though and I would like them to be a bit larger for easier use . I found the battery cover on the back of the thermometer display a bit difficult to remove . The battery cover could use some ridges for easier removal . Once powered on the transmitter starts flashing a red LED that indicates that it is transmitting. < br />< br /> The thermometer has a nice large display with a blue backlight that includes the meat selection , wellness level , target temperature , current temperature and timer . The display is clear and easy to see at certain angles but fades and is hard to see in certain positions . The blue backlight also tends to wash out the top of the display . The front of the thermometer has several buttons including the mode for C / F , meat selector , taste selector , clear , minute / second buttons and start / stop . The top of the thermometer display also has a light button , which for some reason when pressed it lights up and also changes the taste setting . Not sure why it does that . With the exception of the light button , the buttons are also a bit small and crowded together and I would like to see them a bit bigger but they work. < br />< br /> The back of the thermometer has a clip for wearing on the belt or shirt and the range of the thermometer is good indicating in the instructions it is capable of reading at nearly 100 feet ( the Amazon page says 65 feet ) . I walked about 50 feet away and the indicator read the temperature with no issue . Because this relies on the transmitter base , I would have liked if they had included a plug for using the probe directly into the thermometer , just in case the base goes bad. < br />< br /> At the right angle , the screen is easy to read with lots of cooking options . Unlike another thermometer I recently tried , the meat presets for this thermometer are accurate . There is also a manual mode for setting your own temperature but doing this is n't as easy as some thermometers I have used . The thermometer does not have a memory for any settings ( i.e. you have to change to F each time you turn on ) and there is no way to save the manual temperature settings. < br />< br /> The cooking temperatures seem to be fairly accurate within a degree or two from other thermometers I compared it , which I consider reasonable for cooking . The temperature alarm is loud enough to alert you and sounds accurately when the desired temperature is reached. < br />< br /> The temperature probe for this thermometer has an approximately 3 foot long cord appears to be a fairly standard one for this type of thermometers . Having used quite a few of these over the years , I have learned that you have to treat the probe wires delicately and not bend or pinch them or they will quickly fail and this probe has to be treated in a similar manner. < br />< br /> This wireless thermometer seems to be accurate in its temperatures and with its presets , has a good range and seems to be well made . The display is large and easy to read but at certain angles fades . The backlight is a bit too bright at the top and also makes the top of the display hard to read and for some reason also changes the taste selection when pressed . The buttons are a bit small and crowded . There is no warranty information for this thermometer , leading me to believe the warranty is 90 days or less. < br />< br /> 4 stars < br />< br /> I was provided a sample in exchange for an honest review . I do not promise a good rating in return , nor am I affiliated with this company or compensated in any way . I am just a regular Amazon customer who shops a lot on Amazon.e the warranty is 90 days or less . 4 stars I was provided a sample in exchange for an honest review . I do not promise a good rating in return , nor am I affiliated with this company or compensated in any way . I am just a regular Amazon customer who shops a lot on Amazon .#### #### ####[([225], [222], 'POS'), ([261], [269], 'POS'), ([130], [133], 'POS')]

While we bought this mainly for commercial uses involving restaurant equipment , we 've bee quite pleased with the responsiveness and accuracy in our initial at home testing . I was unsure how one might put this to use outside of commercial applications but we 've actually found multiple uses for it at home . Kitchen uses include checking surface temperature for internal meat temperatures , gauging temperature for yogurt cultures in the process of making at-home-yogurt , and logging the various stages of yeast in bread making . Around the house uses include checking pipes for water temperature ( obviously this cannot read inside the pipes but can help track hot water flow and be valuable in logging frozen pipe progression ,) monitoring PC surface and hard drive temperatures for signs of overheating , taking engine temperatures , and identifying leaks and issues with indoor heating / cooling vents and systems . But , if you 're here , you likely already have an intended use in mind , so let 's get to the nitty-gritty :< br />< br />* If you are new to infrared thermometers then you will need to understand that , while the laser is useful in helping to pinpoint the temperature reading location it is NOT the source of readings or the spot where the reading is most accurately pulled from . For the most intuitive and accurate guns you will likely want a dual laser - where the reading is taken from the surface between the two points on the projected surface . In this case the laser is top located and the readings are incrementally below the projected laser dot. < br />< br />* Keep in mind , while this can be helpful in cooking it should not be relied upon over an internal temperature probe . It is only useful in measuring surface temperatures . While thickness and cooking speed varies by cut and type of meat , you can estimate internal temperature by surface temperature but it 's really not the most accurate if that 's your sole purchase in owning this gun . Stick to surface temperatures and in cases where fractions of a degree are notated for important measurements , refer to the manufacturer 's surface guide . Different types of surfaces minimally impact the accuracy of readings . This is not a reflection of this particular unit 's efficacy , but something to take into account as , for example , shiny surfaces such as stainless steel tend to reflect ambient surrounding temperatures rather than the physical material temperature . ( If that sounds like gibberish , hot stainless steel will read lower in temperature than true surface temperature due to it 's physical properties , so take this into account when measuring for the most accurate notations. )< br />< br />* Not to beat a dead horse , but off of the above , I could not find a way to set emissivity which is preset to the common - 0.95 for most organic surface and painted surface readings . Some more advanced thermo guns will allow you to adjust emissivity to better account for the above mentioned concept. < br />< br />* Scanning surfaces provides a pretty accurate live measurement of temperature - Remember to point the gun towards a neutral surface before pointing it at ( scanning it over to ) the desired measured surface . This will provide the most accurate reading . I did note that the further away I got the accuracy decreased by a few degrees . I found most accurate readings were less than 18 &# 34 ; from the measured surface. < br />< br />* One quarm I have about this unit is that it times out pretty fast after measurements . As it does n't store measurements , you have to be pretty quick with notations , should you plan on using this to record regular temperature readings. < br />< br />* This unit includes a 9 volt battery , which it runs off - The battery compartment is hidden behind that black piece below the trigger . It is a bit of a pain to open up and still takes me a while to work open . When one side breaks free the other seals tight - there just is no simple way to pinch both tabs and open them at once. < br />< br />* The ability to turn the backlight on or off and the automatic low battery warning are nice energy saving convenience features for the user. < br />< br /> In all , this unit was providing us with surface measurements accurate to . 4 -. 6 degree ( F ) range at 18 &# 34 ; distance on hot and cold surfaces . The laser indicator seems to be just above the read point at this distance and we are quite pleased with the speed of reading ( we simply wish there was a way to keep the reading on the gun longer . ) If you are looking for an affordable pyrometer for around the house and general DIY uses this is more than accurate enough and easy to use . For more precision work and pinpoint measurements ( where fractions of temporal variance matters ) you might want to look for a unit with dual lasers and emissivity settings. < br />< br /> We received a discount on this item in hopes we would share our insight and honest opinion , which we have done.saving convenience features for the user . In all , this unit was providing us with surface measurements accurate to . 4 -. 6 degree ( F ) range at 18 &# 34 ; distance on hot and cold surfaces . The laser indicator seems to be just above the read point at this distance and we are quite pleased with the speed of reading ( we simply wish there was a way to keep the reading on the gun longer . ) If you are looking for an affordable pyrometer for around the house and general DIY uses this is more than accurate enough and easy to use . For more precision work and pinpoint measurements ( where fractions of temporal variance matters ) you might want to look for a unit with dual lasers and emissivity settings . We received a discount on this item in hopes we would share our insight and honest opinion , which we have done .#### #### ####[([235], [232], 'POS'), ([67], [62], 'POS'), ([53], [48], 'POS'), ([131], [127], 'POS')]

This year in our garden we decided to keep it simple and planted only two herbs . We planted Sweet Basil and an Italian Oregano . I love to cook with fresh herbs but where I live it gets very cold for over half the year so instead of using fresh herbs we opt instead to dry them. < br /> Usually we pick a day after everything has dried out and we use our hands , in a friction manner , to ground the herbs , and then put them in their jars. < br /> That is , until I received my Herb Grinder in the mail . The 3 &# 34 ; Herb Grinder by KingTop is the first time I 've ever used anything like this. < br /> It makes breaking up the herbs so easy and relatively mess free . The four pieces each screw together tightly and with its small but mighty look you would be surprised by the weight it packs. < br /> I recommend washing the pieces well before starting because there was some oil residue but it 's metal and that can be expected . The oil came off and now it 's clean as a whistle. < br /> The compartments fascinated me and once my hubby showed me how to work it I became an old pro within minutes , and the smell that is produced from the crushed herbs is just absolutely Devine . I felt like I needed to stop and make spaghetti right then and there !< br /> I know they make a larger size as well as this 3 &# 34 ; but this fits in my hand nicely so before purchasing figure out what works best for you because I really like the size of my Herb Grinder. < br /> I was able to purchase my Herb Grinder by KingTop at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion .#### #### ####[([122], [121], 'POS'), ([32], [23], 'POS'), ([159], [158], 'POS'), ([127], [121], 'POS')]

Once you get the hang of it , this product does its job ... for bottles . I used it to remove bottle bottoms for an art project , so my score lines were about 1 cm from the bottom of the bottles . What worked for me : Score the bottle with an oiled blade , and do not overlap your score . Pour boiling water over the score for about 10 seconds while rotating the bottle for even heating . You do not need to fill the bottle with anything , just heat the outside . Then move the bottle to an ice bath for about 10 seconds ( again , not necessary to put any liquid into the bottle ) . Then back to the boiling water . Keep the bottle near the floor of your sink so the piece that falls off does n't fall too far and break . You can put a towel or a mat in the bottom of your sink to cushion the fall . It was during this 2nd boiling water stage that the bottles came apart at my score mark , most of the time quite neatly . If it is not neat , you can try giving what needs to come off a tap with the tapper , but results were much less reliable . Wear safety glasses and gloves. < br />< br /> Jars : I tried to use this on a jar by drilling a hole in the jar lid ( as recommended by the manufacturer ) for the device to sit in , but as soon as I started putting pressure on the blade , the hole in the jar lid started warping and there was no way to get a straight score .#### #### ####[([188], [191], 'POS')]

Unusual name for a company Blue Avocado … but whatever works ?! ? I am delighted to be the proud owner of these re-usable and freezable short term storage bags . No more Ziploc bags for me given the fact they ’re not BPA-free , and the Blue Avocado line is . Cross contamination is no laughing matter , so avoid using these with foods where that ’s possible like with meats unless you mark the bags . Also avoid using with foods that stain , unless you do n’t mind discoloration of your bags . Considerable effort is needed to open and close these bags once in the freezer . Cooking food in the bags is not recommended , as they ’re not designed to take that abuse . $ 20 is a bit pricy for 4 different size bags , and if you wish to add some additional sizes , expect to pay an additional $ 30-60 for several additional sizes . I suspect and hope prices will come down as demand may increase over time , because I really need more gallon sizes . Even though Blue Avocado is a bit late to the BPA-free party , I ’m glad they ’re around . This is what short term food storage is supposed to look like .#### #### ####[([34], [32], 'POS'), ([212], [202], 'POS'), ([150], [160], 'POS')]

This little wine saver pump is an awesome fix for that problem !< br />< br /> It 's relatively simple to use , all you have to do is put the rubber topper into the neck of the bottle and then use the hand pump to remove the remaining air and create a nice , tight seal . This vegetable spiral slicer is a simple and compact device that can be run through a dishwasher after use and then tossed in a drawer. < br />< br /> It works like a crayon sharpener , except that the shavings are also sliced into strips . One side cuts thinner and narrower strips , while the other makes thicker and wider strips. < br />< br /> The length of the strips obtained depends on the density and firmness of the vegetable being cut . Zucchini and cucumbers work best . Carrots and potatoes come out much shorter and are sometimes difficult to turn in the cones . Celery does n't work at all . I have n't tried anything mushy like a tomato. < br />< br /> The metal plates on the outside look like blades , but they function as stiffeners and handles . There is a lid with spikes to hold stubby vegetables and it works okay with ends of carrots or leftover bits of potato . There is inevitably a bit or two with any type of slicer that wo n't go through. < br />< br /> The blades are very sharp , so keep the slicer away from children. < br />< br /> Accessories included are a small brush for cleaning the blades and central core , a drawstring storage bag , and a peeler with a plastic blade. < br />< br /> Best4UWorldwide provided a spiral slicer for evaluation and review .#### #### ####[([251], [246], 'POS'), ([53], [57], 'POS')]

Gorman is a division of the Lenox Corporation that sells cookware including cast iron pots , pans , and cooking utensils . Rick Bayless is a chef famous for his cooking , writing , and restaurants focusing in part on Mexican cuisine . The Mexican Kitchen line by Rick Bayless offers a slotted food turner is great for saut & eacute ; ing and serving dishes associated with dining south of the border . The spatula is 14in long , great for use with large pots . The turner has a red silicone wrapped handle 6in long that has small raised bumps that provide a good grip . There is a hole at the end of the handle that allows for hanging on a hook ready to grab and use . The last inch of the silicone wrap is flexible with no wood within. < br />< br /> The spatula is made of Beachwood with a smooth surface that is safe to use with non-stick cooking surfaces . The spatula has a slight upward curve that tapers from . 25in to a sharp end making it sturdy and easy to cook with food in a flat pan , especially heavy portions of meats . Two 1.75in slots provide for draining of sauces and easy stirring of cooking ingredients . I use the turner most of the time while cooking preferring it to other spatulas that I have . I wash the spatula by hand although there is no instruction related to dishwasher use . Wood utensils seem to be popular with professional chefs today , and I have found this to be an excellent cooking utensil for home cooking .#### #### ####[([30], [40], 'POS'), ([203], [196], 'POS'), ([252], [262], 'POS')]

This is n't my first Freshware , and to tell you the truth , UI would n't have bought this if I had desiraqble options. < br />< br /> You see , after baking in Freshware , there 's a white powdery residue . It 's almost impossible to get rid of it with a washrag and Dawn , because when you press against Freshware with the washrag or brush , it squirrels out from under , As far as I can tell , it 's not affecting the flavor or taste of my baked goods , nor is it likely to be a health risk . I suspect it 's mostly flour , but I do n't know , and it 's the uncertainty that bothers me. < br />< br /> Oh,the lack of options ? A 3-cup-of-flour dough will make a round loaf in a dutch oven , or a rectangular loaf . It will make a dozen rolls in a cupcake tin . It will make four loaves that are * perfect * for slider sandwiches . Kids love pb & j sliders , or grilled cheese sliders , and adults seem to favor them as well . But a hanburger slider is too doggoned small , and a full size loaf is too buig a burger unless you 're hugely hungry . This pan lets me split the dough recipe in six and make hamburger buns. < br />< br /> Oh , it 's not perfect for that . You ger a squat mushroom shape . Still , they work adequately well . Surely , you say , there are other baking tins for making burgewr buns . Yeppers . Chicago Metallic makes one that looks like it 'd be wonderful , but it 's too big for my &# 34 ; apartment-size &# 34 ; oven , and I 'd have to buy a dozen pans , which is overkill for this widower living alone. < br />< br /> And if you 're reading this as someone from a baking tin company ( are you insulted , Freshware , if I call your floppy baking pan &# 34 ; tins &# 34 ;? Sorry !) you need to add two items to your line . One is a pan with six long cavities for baking hoagy rolls , and the other would have a dozen long cavities for breadsticks . Yes , they both can be baked on a cookie sheet , but it 's easier to get a uniform appearance with a baking tin . Just keep it to 14 &# 34 ; x14 &# 34 ; and sell the , by the &# 34 ; each &# 34 ;.< br />< br /> The cavities here are about 2,75 inches in diameter but the bread dough bulges to give a nice mushroom = shaped burger bun . Remember the Seinfeld episode with &# 34 ; Top of The Muffin &# 34 ; ? This would be great for that. < br />< br /> Whoopie pies , too . This is * exactly * the sight size . But you only get three whoopie pies from six cavities , and you 're supposed to let stuff cool in the freshware tins , so you might want to buy 6 or 8 tins . I find it 's easiest to use a pizza peel to put freshware into or out of a hot oven. < br />< br /> A few years ago , I discovered a company that made peanut prittle in pie pans , and sold the round , unbroken , wrapped in heavy saran , instead of breaking the brittle up and hiding it in a box . I 'd think this woulde be wonderful for making a smaller version , which could be sold to kids at a school carnival , or something like that . Peanut brittle is pretty easy to make , is universally appealing , and with no boxes to buy , would be pretty cheap to make . I 've not tried it yet , though. < br />< br /> I 'm not thrilled by this item . I 'd rather have a cavity about 3.25 &# 34 ; diameter , and as I said , I 'd rather have steel . On the other hand , I 'm satisfied enough that I plan on buying a second one , and possibly getting three more , for whoopie4 pie or peanut brittle use . I found this out the hard way . To help control the cutter , I notched the top of a 2 gallon bucket and rested the cutter , serrated side up in the notches . I 've been starting to use silicone in the kitchen because of how easy it is to store and of how well it works . This is my first time using a silicone baking tray but I love it ! It can be baked in heats up to 464 degrees Fahrenheit , so this is basically safe for anything I 'll ever cook !< br />< br /> It is made of a food-grade silicone and is flexible , making it able to be stored anywhere . This mat has hundreds of pyramid shaped triangles to allow drainage for fat and oil to comes out of food . We eat a lot of lean proteins such as fish and chicken in my house so having this remove extra fat and grease is so helpful !< br />< br /> FIRST TIME USE : Before I used it for baking , I followed the instructions and put the silicone mat in the oven for about 10 minutes at 225 degrees to rid it of the silicone smell. < br />< br /> SIZE : This baking mat is 16 &# 34 ; by 11 &# 34 ; , but can easily be trimmed with scissors if you need to fit it inside a smaller baking tray !< br />< br /> I decided to bake fish on it , so I put the mat in a baking tray and placed frozen fish on it with some seasoning ( no oil ) and baked it at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for 20 minutes . Upon removing it from the oven , I could see the excess water and fat at the base of the mat ! The fish tasted great and was not dried out at all , either !< br />< br /> This is also dishwasher safe ! I washed it in the dishwasher after cooking and it came out just fine ! No melting , no discoloration-looked brand new !< br />< br /> I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review and feedback . My opinions are 100 % my own but I 'm sure that this will be enjoyed by anyone who wants to eat cleaner , eat less fat and reduce their calorie intake ! I already own , and use , the [[ ASIN : B000A1EX34 Norpro Tortilla Pancake Keeper ]] , which is lightweight , dishwasher safe and warms a significant amount of tortillas quickly and easily , though I do n’t think it keeps them warm a substantial amount of time . Still , that turns out to not be that big of deal when they can be so quickly reheated in the same container . The main downsides of the Norpro is that it 's not very attractive , and it 's basically a one-trick pony. < br />< br /> I use the simple method of a slightly damp , clean kitchen towel with tortillas wrapped inside , within the tortilla holder . Then pop the whole thing in the microwave for 1:30-2:00 for warm , steamed tortillas . The Norpro works great with that method and , if the tortillas cool off , I just throw the whole thing back in the microwave for another 30-45 seconds. < br />< br /> Still , despite being mostly happy with the much less expensive plastic Norpro , I was wooed by this super pretty stoneware holder that looks identical to one I ’ve admired for a while in Williams-Sonoma , though that was n’t the Bayless brand model. < br />< br /> This bright red piece is heavy-duty , dishwasher safe glazed stoneware ( interior is cream colored ) , but much shorter than the Norpro , making it hard to fit a useful amount of tortillas , plus the damp towel inside . It also suffered from becoming a bit too hot to handle when I tried to microwave — though it is perfectly microwave safe — it for as long as I was used to heating the Norpro for. < br />< br /> Not , burn-yourself hot , but a little warm for comfortable bare-handed handling , and I feared someone dropping the hot ( ish ) stoneware lid and breaking it . Of course , it does cool down relatively quickly (&# 62 ; 5 min. ) , so this is a fairly minor concern. < br />< br /> I did find a few easy workarounds for actually warming tortillas by my preferred method in this … First , I ditched the towel altogether and just misted the tortilla stack itself lightly before putting the lid on . This made the top tortilla a tiny bit soggier than I prefer , but left the others nicely fresh and steamed , though the warmer itself still got a little hotter than I ’d like. < br />< br /> Next , I went back to the damp towel , but just set it on a plate to warm , and then transferred the tortillas to the Bayless warmer for serving . This method worked quite well , in that the tortillas warmed / steamed even faster than in the Norpro , and the Bayless stoneware kept them warm longer once inside , but was still cool to the touch for serving. < br />< br /> The other option is placing it in a warm oven (~ 200 degrees ) , something the plastic Norpro ca n’t do , to hold pancakes or already steamed tortillas at temp until serving . I found this very handy when serving for a crowd. < br />< br /> It could also be used , unlike a dedicated tortilla warmer , for a covered casserole , or other general serving options , making this one a bit more multi-purpose , which I liked. < br />< br /> All in all , this a lovely piece , that does work for its intended purpose , as so do lesser priced options . Still , this is a beautiful bit of serveware I ’m happy to have.er , but left the others nicely fresh and steamed , though the warmer itself still got a little hotter than I ’d like . Next , I went back to the damp towel , but just set it on a plate to warm , and then transferred the tortillas to the Bayless warmer for serving . This method worked quite well , in that the tortillas warmed / steamed even faster than in the Norpro , and the Bayless stoneware kept them warm longer once inside , but was still cool to the touch for serving . The other option is placing it in a warm oven (~ 200 degrees ) , something the plastic Norpro ca n’t do , to hold pancakes or already steamed tortillas at temp until serving . I found this very handy when serving for a crowd . It could also be used , unlike a dedicated tortilla warmer , for a covered casserole , or other general serving options , making this one a bit more multi-purpose , which I liked . All in all , this a lovely piece , that does work for its intended purpose , as so do lesser priced options . Still , this is a beautiful bit of serveware I ’m happy to have .#### #### ####[([127], [134], 'POS'), ([230], [224], 'POS'), ([185], [183], 'POS')]

The Thermos ELEMENT5 16 ounce mug is the travel mug to buy !! ! This mug is all stainless steel , including the interior , where the food or drink constantly touches . It holds the temperature for hours ( as advertised ) . This mug has the simplest , most functional design of any mugs I reviewed . The silver stainless color will always remain the same even if it gets small scratches while being used . The main advantage is that It has a one-piece lid that is very easy to clean and dry and has no parts to break or get lost ( see below ).< br />< br /> I also bought the Thermos cranberry-red 16 ounce stainless steel King travel mug ( with handle ) . While I like the colored mug , it will probably get scratched over time . Both of the Thermos mugs hold the temperature for hours , and both of these mugs performed perfectly . Both have stainless steel interiors and exteriors where the drink is in constant contact . But the lid of the cranberry mug is made with 3 separate parts that have to be dissassembled in order to be cleaned and dried . One of the parts is very small and could be rinsed down a sink , making the mug lid unusable. < br />< br /> Buy the ELEMENT5 stainless steel travel mug instead . A friend of mine ordered this STX International STX-1000-CE chef 's elite 15 minute vacuum marinator and could n't stop talking about how tender the meat was after using it . I finally decided that since my boys love to grill , it might be worth a try , and since I know from experience with previous dealings with the STX personnel that they are easy to work with if not satisfied , I went ahead and got one . ( I thought to myself that this marinator really could n't make THAT much difference , but I was completely unprepared for what I experienced !)< br />< br /> We first grilled chicken breasts , and I noticed that most of the sauce I used to marinate the chicken had disappeared after 20 minutes of marinating . The vacuum process had actually drawn the sauce into the holes we had poked into the chicken . Hmmm , I thought , but will it really deliver after being grilled . Absolutely ! It was the most tender chicken breast I ever remember eating ! I actually was dumbfounded , and the flavor was amazing !< br />< br /> Next , we tried T-bone steaks . I decided to experiment and marinated half in the STX-1000-CE and did n't marinate the other half at all . Needless to say , it was not at all difficult to tell the difference between the two . The boys actually seemed a little disappointed and even commented that it did n't really seem to them like steak because it was n't tough & chewy . Are you kidding me ?! ? I 'll take steak that eats and tastes like prime rib any day of the week over tough steak !< br />< br /> This product helped me to understand how meat is meant to taste . Thank you !#### #### ####[([129], [120], 'POS')]

This review was done by a 30 something mother of 7 . Item : 12 Inch Round Premium Non-stick Silicone Baking Mat Item Description : • NON-STICK MAT FOR BETTER BAKING • Professional quality BPA Free • Safe for oven , microwave , dishwasher Product Review : I was really excited to get this item in the mail ( as were the kids because they knew that meant we had to try it out ) . We decided we would bake chocolate chip cookies on it our first go round . I put my round mat on a rectangle pan from Williams Sonoma . I added 3 cookies onto the pan with cooking spray and we baked the rest on the mat . The ones on the pan came out much crispier . The ones on the mat were lighter on the bottom , but crisped once they had cooled a bit . When they first came out there were “ gooey ” in comparison to the ones directly on the pan . I had to let them cool to prevent them falling apart . Overall , the mat was a very easy clean up . It cooked evenly . I would like purchase a larger one for my rectangle pans in the future . I am anxious to use this mat for other baking to see how those items turn out . Pictures are 1 ) before cooking 2 ) after baking 3 ) bottoms of the cookies I purchased this item at a discounted price and was asked to give my unbiased review on the product . This review is 100 % my own and the cost of the product does not reflect my review in any way . I would n't give a good review if it was n't a good product !#### #### ####[([41], [37], 'POS'), ([20], [29], 'POS')]

Having been a user of paper filters for ages , i decided to cut down on my carbon footprint and try the reusable cloth filters . Doing a side by side comparison of cloth vs paper , i found the coffee was less acidic tasting when using the cloth . You do have to wash well after each use . I have read some people have put their cloth filters in a container with water in the fridge to keep mold from growing on it , I have been using the same filter daily for 3 months now , after use , I wash it well with warm water , let it air dry and I have not had a mold problem . Yes , this is a bit expensive , but it is definitely worth it . We had been using a cheap aluminum Whirly Popper for a long time , though cooking with aluminum is not the best since some can leech into the food . Switching to the Lindy 's Stainless Steel popper has been a great change . The unit is very sturdy , well constructed and feels solid . Gas stove tip : You do not want to cook your popcorn too fast with high heat . Instead , add 1-2 tablespoons coconut oil , turn gas on medium heat , and add 1 / 2 cup of your favorite popcorn . Swirl the popper a bit to coat the kernels with oil and then let it sit there while it heats up . There is no need to crank the handle while the oil heats up . You will know it has heated up when a few kernels start to pop which may take 3-5 minutes . When the popping starts , begin cranking the handle . Once the popping slows down , remove from the heat and continue to stir . The unit has such a large base that it retains heat very well allowing the remaining kernels to continue to pop for ~ 30 seconds while it is off the heat ! Open the lid when you hear the last few kernels pop to let out the steam . Pour in a bowl and add some Movie Theater Seasoning and enjoy the best popcorn in the world !#### #### ####[([21], [26], 'POS'), ([32], [36], 'POS')]

I also mix in an extra 2 pinches of brown sugar and crushed red pepper. . let marinade overnight then dehydrate on highest setting till its done. .< br />< br /> The snackmaster kit is an excellent value. . The rounded bottom of the blender jar lets fruit and ice &# 34 ; float &# 34 ; and circulate through the blender jar , so that they will blend evenly . I 've never gotten an issue where only the bottom part of the blender would &# 34 ; blend &# 34 ; as everything else just sits up top and you have to mix it up with a big spoon . It just plain works. < br />< br /> The jar itself is also easy to clean . I also like the little timer on the motor that gives you a countdown until it will threaten to overheat. < br />< br /> I 'm drinking a frozen strawberry , banana , and kiwi smoothie right now . I was somewhat disappointed by this shaker . There are several nice things about it . It does n't leak . The bottom cup can be used as a drink cup or for storing whatever powder you want to mix in the top later , like a protein drink that would get yucky if you mix too far ahead . The measurement markings are clear and easy to read , and are embossed so will not wear off . The cover for the hole in the lid is quite tight , and I 'd suggest opening and closing it a couple of times to loosen it just a tiny bit before you have liquid in the shaker. < br />< br /> What I do n't like so much is that the steel feels quite thin to me , and of course , transfers the hot / cold of the liquid to your hand because of that . The agitator is just a piece of plastic affixed to the lid , kind of an empty hub with 6 plastic spokes running from the center hub to the sides . I 'll attach photos as soon as I can . I do n't really see how that really works as an agitator . It does mix powders and liquid well , but I do n't see that it does a better job than shakers without that bit of plastic. < br />< br /> The thing that really sets this apart is the compartment that allows you to take an unmixed powder with you , and mix when needed . Other than that , it is pretty standard fare and not something I 'd go out of my way to replace. < br />< br /> I was given this product for review .#### #### ####[([141], [145], 'NEU'), ([113], [108], 'NEU'), ([61], [52], 'NEU')]

Like &# 34 ; Death and Taxes &# 34 ; , it is inevitable that the &# 34 ; Stick &# 34 ; in your Non-Stick pan , will one day visit . I purchased this pan about two years ago , and still use it when I need the room . It 's well made , and I 've had no problem with &# 34 ; bowing &# 34 ; while using it on a gas stove . At first , I was in love with this pan , as deeply as a teenage boy could be with his first girlfriend . This pan was so slick when new , it seemed to defy the laws of physics . A fresh egg , dropped into a hot , naked pan , seemed to slide around as if the laws of gravity had been repealed . But alas , after only a few months of steady use , those magic properties faded . Food began sticking a bit more after each use , and cleanup got progressively cumbersome . Mind you , it is still a good cooking pan ( when well greased ) , but those halcyon days of &# 34 ; floating food &# 34 ; and effortless clean-up with just a whisper of a touch from a dishcloth , have faded into distant memories . Like your first girlfriend , the initial enchantment will leave you awestruck ; but with time , the sticky sorrows come . Enjoy the brief season of carefree cooking whilst you can , for soon enough you are sure to be visited by either death , taxes , or stick .#### #### ####[([231], [225], 'POS'), ([253], [255], 'POS'), ([253], [246], 'POS'), ([174], [177], 'POS')]

The Good : Fits in small freezer in office ' fridge . The cube you want pushes out without a problem , the others stay put , and your fingers do n't freeze . No taste added to cubes that I could tell , though I washed my trays thoroughly when they arrived . Wo n't freeze stuck to the freezer floor. < br />< br /> The not-so-Good : Difficult to fill all cavities to a safe level , especially without being at a sink . There is no difference in height between cubes and the edge of the tray , so no inclination for the water to fill cavities rather than run over the side . In my office , I ended up using a large syringe to adjust the water level in each cavity , which sounds silly but it worked . The silicon does n't conduct cold very well which is good for your fingers but makes the time to freezing solid take longer , especially as there is no space for cold air to circulate between cubes. < br />< br /> Overall recommended if these do n't sound like major problems for you .#### #### ####[([177], [176], 'POS'), ([133], [140], 'POS'), ([133], [127], 'POS'), ([78], [68], 'POS')]

I now own two of these and ironically each has been branded by different companies . ( I paid twice as much for the first unit purchased a few years ago ! ) Both units perform as expected and include everything you need . ( Timer , probe temp and temp alarm . ) Strong magnets on the bottom of the unit allow you to attach it to a ' cool ' metal surface on the side of your grill , smoker , etc . A single AAA battery seems to last forever ! ! The only reason I wo n't rate it five stars is due to the probe . As many others have warned , you CANNOT submerse the entire probe in water . Water will enter the probe where the temperature cable is crimped . Not a big deal , a wet soapy rag does the trick but you CANNOT forget nor should you assume anyone helping you to clean up knows about this issue. < br /> I cannot confirm the following statement but I have a feeling this unit is no longer manufactured because replacement parts ( accessories / replacement probes ) are difficult to find . I purchased a second probe when I bought the first unit a few years ago so I was not deterred by this issue . Besides , for $ 20 ( vs. .+$ 50 for newer models ) how can you go wrong ! I thought about buying a ' spare ' but I have no reason to believe either unit will fail anytime soon .#### #### ####[([76], [86], 'POS')]

This battery operated kitchen tool provides a way to add a smoked flavor to food that may be impossible to place in an actual smoker either because it is too delicate in texture or intolerant to heat . This gadget sparks the imagination . Salted caramels , mild Havarti cheese , a martini or popcorn are just a few examples of food items that may be enhanced by a touch of smoke. < br />< br /> Unfamiliar with the company , PolyScience Culinary , I did not know what level of quality to expect but was reassured that they are a division of Breville USA , Inc . This company creates mid to high-end small kitchen appliances &# 62 ; I own and regularly use a couple of their products and am pleased with both performance and durability. < br />< br /> Per the included instruction booklet , do not generate smoke for more than 30 seconds at a time . Capture that smoke with the gun alone or use the hose attachment under a domed dish or lid which covers the food or drink and let the item linger in the smoke for two or three minutes , although depending upon the item it may stay a bit longer if desired. < br />< br /> My first test was infusing a bowl of garlic mashed potatoes and then mac and cheese . It worked better to place the device on its stand and use the flexible hose attachment to accurately direct the smoke under the lid . So , thirty seconds of smoke expelled and then the food rested in the cloudy haze for three to four minutes which seemed adequate to impart a good flavor although that will undoubtedly vary based on the food involved. < br />< br /> For a small device , the gun generates a surprising amount of smoke so be sure the area is well ventilated and away from nearby smoke detectors . I opened a window in the kitchen and turned on the cook top exhaust fan and that helped control it . And , there was not much residual smoke smell although the open window probably helped For someone with compromised lungs , this device might present a problem. < br />< br /> The lid or dome selected does not need to be air tight although a good fit helps corral the smoke . The set includes two small sample bottles of apple and hickory wood chips ( really more like shavings ) but when these are depleted I plan to experiment to see if crushing ( hammering ) regular smoker wood pellets or large chips will work to obtain the fine texture for this so I can use what I have on hand and avoid the expense of buying small jars of shavings . And , other items can be used in the gun , like tea or herbs. < br />< br /> Included in the sturdy box are the gun , four AA batteries , the device stand , flexible tubing , two small jars of wood chips and a helpful clearly written instruction guide . Regular cleanings and maintenance are a must to remove the residue from burning wood chips . Details are included in the user manual. < br />< br /> Things I plan to try with a smoke infusion are hummus , smoked nuts , bean soup , potato and macaroni salad , deviled eggs , different types of cheese , tamales , burritos and cocktails . If giving as a gift , everything needed to immediately try the device is in the box except matches or a lighter to start the shavings.air tight although a good fit helps corral the smoke . The set includes two small sample bottles of apple and hickory wood chips ( really more like shavings ) but when these are depleted I plan to experiment to see if crushing ( hammering ) regular smoker wood pellets or large chips will work to obtain the fine texture for this so I can use what I have on hand and avoid the expense of buying small jars of shavings . And , other items can be used in the gun , like tea or herbs. < br />< br /> Included in the sturdy box are the gun , four AA batteries , the device stand , flexible tubing , two small jars of wood chips and a helpful clearly written instruction guide . Regular cleanings and maintenance are a must to remove the residue from burning wood chips . Details are included in the user manual. < br />< br /> Things I plan to try with a smoke infusion are hummus , smoked nuts , bean soup , potato and macaroni salad , deviled eggs , different types of cheese , tamales , burritos and cocktails . 24 hour review ...< br />< br /> I usually drink one lg cup of coffee / day and I like it strong . I had a small inexpensive blade grinder , but what a pain , small hopper and no consistency . This one holds up to 1 / 2 lb of beans , enough for a week or more at my strength preference . I 've had two cups in two days . First cup a little week , so I increased the quantity of coffee for the second cup . Both times the grinder was set for a drip grind . I noticed that I seemed to be getting more volume of brewed coffee into the pot than I did prior to using this grinder . So perhaps increasing the amount of coffee is n't the solution , but rather decreasing the size of the grind , Next cup , back to original quantity and smaller grind , I 'll send an update after a few more brews. < br />< br /> Pros : Large hopper , dial a grind size and quantity , EASY to use , consistent ( mostly grind ) , quick to grind , grind exactly what you need and no more , grind enough for several days or weeks and store in zip lock. < br />< br /> Cons : a bit more bulky than I would like , but what can I expect , it holds a 1 / 2 lb in the hopper . LOUD , much louder than my blade grinder , but I can deal with it. < br />< br /> More to come .#### #### ####[([35], [37], 'POS'), ([156], [155], 'POS'), ([15], [22], 'POS')]

Others may have found that aspect a ' con ' but I feel it 's a ' pro ' . Have not had any issues w spilling , but that might be since he is used to using a cup w / o a closure on the lid hole . This is a serious piece of cast iron ! I own a round Lodge cast iron comal and in comparison , this one is heavier , larger , with a deeper lip . It is perfect for grilling meat , vegetables , reheating or cooking tortillas , pancakes , French toast -- pretty much anything you can cook on a griddle or grill pan . I have a heavy duty commercial / home range with large burners and this pan is perfect for covering one burner . Once you heat it up , you can turn the heat down and maintain a very hot pan without needing to keep the heat cranked up . A lot of cast iron pans claim to be pre-seasoned , but this one actually acts that way . Once I rinsed the pan in hot , soapy water and dried , I simply gave it a light coating of olive oil and proceeded to make great chicken fajitas in no time at all . I rinsed the pan in hot water for a few moments and used a copper scrubbee thing on it -- voila ! -- clean as a whistle . The description says it is dishwasher safe but that is erroneous ! Do not put this pan in the dishwasher ! By not using soap , you can start to build up a great nonstick finish . Put the pan on a burner for a few moments and touch up with a towel , so there is no risk of rust . You can use metal utensils on this pan without fear ; it 's super rugged . Take it camping , stick it in the oven -- do whatever you want but drop it on your foot ( it 's heavy ) ! The price point is quite a bit higher than the Lodge comal , but as I mentioned earlier , it 's larger and much heavier . A pan like this , cared for properly , will last a lifetime and become a family heirloom . Gorham is a highly respected company and it 's easy to see why . Please note : the surface is somewhat rough , but this is a benefit because it helps create a nonstick surface ; it wo n't effect your cooking at all . I had an All-Clad grill pan but I gave it away because it had a nonstick finish that I thought leached into the meats I cooked at high heat ( smelled and tasted that way ) . I got a Le Creuset grill pan that I like , but I think I will end up reaching for this pan more often , even for grilling meats .#### #### ####[([184], [192], 'POS'), ([302], [298], 'POS'), ([4], [3], 'POS'), ([73], [81], 'POS'), ([307], [308], 'POS')]

I 'll just say that ours has lasted almost a year so far , so no complaints there . It produces good tasting coffee depending on what pod you have . The only downside is that you have to clean it very often . This might sound weird , but I was drinking coffee from this machine and I would get really tense and lose sleep even from one cup . It took a little while to realize it , but it think it was the old water that gets left behind after a brew and then gets injected in to the next brew . It was probably moldy and toxic somehow and making me sick . Well I started aggressively rinsing it between each cup and that problem of losing sleep went away . I run 3 cups of water through before I make a cup of coffee . While might seem like more of a downside to some , but for me I still think it is convenient and I enjoy the coffee it produces .#### #### ####[([103], [110], 'POS'), ([174], [169], 'POS'), ([53], [62], 'POS'), ([27], [21], 'POS'), ([94], [102], 'POS')]

After reading mixed reviews I was a bit skeptical , but decided it was the size , price , quality that I wanted so bought it . I have only had it a couple of weeks , but have used it perhaps 6 or 7 times . I did not have any trouble cleaning the manufacture 's coating off , and creating a nice cooked on coating . I was worried about the coating coming off , and rust appearing so after each use I water soak and use a brush to clean off food bits , and then dry on the stove and add oil after dry and wok is still hot . So far I have had no issues with the handle , or with rust . I did have an issue with my coating coming off when I made sweet / sour stir fry . I assumed it was the acid in the pineapple but I am not positive . After this problem I heated the wok very hot and cooked on an oil glaze again . Seemed to work , still no rust or issues with wok. < br />< br /> Updated after using for a couple of years :< br /> I use it probably 5-6 times a month . This product has never rusted , or come apart in anyway . I still give it 5 stars . It works great . I still heat dry on stove after washing , and cook on an oil coat after each use which maintains a nice patina . I realize that the filtering of the water is a bit slow but so what ? If it is going to save our lives and prevent us to get bone cancer from the fluoride that has been added to our drinking water without our consent at all and without any kind of warning to us as to what fluoride can cause to everyone after long term drinking of it , why added to our drinking water ? With what kind of a purpose ? I feel that we all have sense enough to take care of our own teeth without adding something to our drinking water that could kill us . I am so extremely upset about that . Unfortunately if you file a complaint it goes on deaf ears so all we can do is warn our family , friends , neighbors , co-workers and everyone we know to get a filter to get rid of that darn fluoride . But anyway , back to the filter , I really like it and the water tastes amazing ! I 've had several pitchers and also the faucet filter kind and the water has n't tasted this good ever ! I have found myself drinking much more water now and giving more to my dog and he also likes it very much since he is drinking more of it , and I am also cooking with it . Some reviewers stated that it is extremely slow and it takes 14 hours to filter a gallon , that is not true , at least not on mine . It takes approximately 3 to 4 hours to filter a gallon . At the beginning when I started filtering it took about 6 hours but now it has been getting faster and it really serves all my water needs . I have plenty of clean , safe drinking water now and am storing it in the fridge on a different pitcher while continuing to filter water on this pitcher which I keep on my counter . I really recommend this pitcher to anyone that wants to be safe and save their lives by drinking pure , safe water . Ball jars are used for everything from preserving fruits & vegetables to home decor these days . I have a few of the flat , round pint sized ones that I was using to preserve brandied cherries , but now use to store my homemade bath powders . They are versatile and reusable . I purchased two sets sold on this page . The purple pint-sized ones and the green quart sized . To be honest , I liked all of the colors but choose the ones that cost the least amount of money . They arrived quickly and thankfully none were broken or chipped . I mainly use the pint-sized ones for homemade salad dressings and storing golden tumeric paste for my dogs . These seal nice and tight , so that dressings can be given a shake without leaking . The purple color is very pretty and is also a protective color for some types of foods that do not do well exposed to light . The green quart sized ones I am using for chopped , layered salads . These can also be used to store dried foods like chilies or pasta . If you have a hive , these are great to store raw honey in . I think they would look really cool as a pickling jar . These are also a lovely color and wash easily . I am not sure if these quart sized jars are considered wide mouth . The opening is fairly wide and the lids fit my wide mouth pint jars . I have included a picture of the quart sized green jars and a pint-sized purple jar side by side so you can make a comparison and decide which one fits your needs . Many people use the half pint for salad dressings , but I find the pint-size works for me . These jars are also a very pretty way to offer a food gift to a friend .#### #### ####[([220], [217], 'POS')]

There are people that take their coffee making seriously , and others their tea making . This electric kettle is for both . It has several options for water temperatures to give you the perfect boil . You can set up the temperature for delicate white teas all the way 212 deg for hot chocolate . I love tea and the best teas do require a little bit of care , specially Matcha green tea or Shin-Cha green tea . If the water temperature is not right the end result will be a bitter , not so pleasant cup of tea . I brewed my first cup at the suggested temperature for green tea , and let the tea steep for about 3 min , lo and behold it was the best tea I 've had at home that turned out so perfect right off the bat . I no longer have to wait and guess for the water to cool down to achieve the delicate flavor of my delicate teas . The kettle itself looks sleek and elegant , and it is so quiet that you will not believe it 's boiling water ! A soft chime will let you know when your water is ready and it was so cool , because it sounds like the little bell they ring at tea ceremonies . This unit is easy to operate , has a cord that stores under in case you do n't need it too long , has an automatic shut-off feature and a Keep Warm setting . Once you turn it on the On / Off button will flash until the kettle is done so do n't think you need to wait for it to stop flashing for it to do its job . I 'm very very pleased with this electric kettle , I also think it will last a long time because it seems well made and Kenwood is a good brand . DO NOT BUY BASED ON &# 34 ; AMERICA'S TEST KITCHEN ' REVIEW because reviewer lied in the video on the show and then America 's Test Kitchen defended her lie . I bought because she said &# 34 ; just add water , put the pasta in and cook for the length of time it says on the package. &# 34 ; LIE . You have to cook for the length of time it takes to boil the water + the length of time it takes to cook the pasta . It 's just as easy to bring water to a boil on the stove and cook it there -- takes almost exactly the same amount of time . So beware America 's Test Kitchen , Cook 's Country , etc . reviews -- they are misleading like in this case and the company takes absolutely no responsibility for broadcasting misinformation to public . If you want to pay $ 15 for a plastic box , then this is a great deal .#### #### ####[([99], [96], 'NEG'), ([172], [171], 'NEG')]

I used these rings on plastic baggies , not on cupcakes , so , if the sticker were not placed exactly perpendicular to the ring , the ring would look crooked . Not the case , every single ring was perfectly aligned. < br />- arrived on time < br />< br /> CONS < br />- Price . These are way overpriced on Amazon . I found them for more than 50 % less at Target . I really wish I looked there before purchasing from Amazon . I usually only take a star off for price when it is grossly overpriced and easily found elsewhere. < br />< br /> TO BE NOTED :< br />- size was a bit large for my 2 yr old daugther , and slightly large for my 4 yr old son who has chubby fingers and is in the 85 % for height and weight < br />- some of the other reviewers called these &# 34 ; cheap. &# 34 ; I found the quality of the plastic perfect for what they are ... cupcake rings . These are cupcake rings that are intended for small children to play with for a short period of time after the cupcake is served . They were designed to adorn cupcakes , not children . I found the quality to be just fine. < br />- my daughter LOVED seeing all the different characters on the rings. < br />< br /> I would buy this product again .#### #### ####[([185], [184], 'POS')]

UPDATE : This stone ware cooker has been redesigned to have sharp edge interior bottom which is less efficient than my original Stone Ware Cooker with rounded interior bottom . The new has more volume however has added 10 to 20 seconds for cook time . I use the Stone ware cooker with my Mini food processor ; Recipe : In Food Processor ( Proctor Silex 72507 Food Chopper ) add 2 eggs , 1 Tbl Milk ( reg or Condensed ) , 2 finger length pre-cooked frozen sausage ( Banquet Brown-N-serve ) and a pinch of pepper . ( No Salt it stiffens the eggs ) . Process for 5 to 10 seconds . ( Note in Mini Food processors the initial startup may force some liquid to seep out from under the lid . ( Cheap Construction but it works ) In Stoneware a quick shot of Pam then with a paper towel gently spread out the Pam . Pour in egg concoction , replace Lid and Microwave for 2 min . in 1000w MW . Watch as after about 1 min the beginnings of a Souffle lift the lid of the Stoneware . Alas as soon as the time is up the Souffle falls in on itself . :( However the result is close to a Sausage / Egg souffle ) . Add Salt sparingly if that 's your taste . Eggs slip smoothly out of Ceramic pot onto plate then flip over to view your sausage topped fluffy egg breakfast .#### #### ####[([149], [146], 'NEU'), ([14], [11], 'NEU'), ([5], [11], 'NEU'), ([34], [33], 'NEU'), ([43], [33], 'NEU')]

It 's just so convenient to carry that way . I received it today and immediately took it out on a family outing to test it out . I love that it has a latch to make sure that it does n't pop open if you have to throw it in a bag , which we did multiple times with no leaks ! My almost three-year-old son also loved it and insisted on carrying it in his backpack , which made its weight nice . He also loved drinking from it and was able to open and close it himself . Like some of my other bottles , I prefer to drink from it when held sideways . The only problem that this posed was when I got to the last little bit of water and some came out the air vent . I 'll just have to remember to drink it straight on when I 'm down that low . As for size , I really prefer a larger capacity bottle . Since I drink filtered water , I prefer to take a day 's worth of water with me to work and have a glass bottle and an insulated stainless steel bottle that I use for that purpose . I bought this because it said the capacity wound brew 12 cups . If you like yellow coffee , it might . But the metal bowl holds only 3 tablespoons of coffee beans . My CBC approved coffee measuring spoon holds 4 teaspoons . I use one measuring spoon for two 5 ounce cups of coffee . That is half of what the coffee experts recommend . What I get is restaurant strength coffee . Now the math . A restaurant style cup holds 8 liquid ounces . Today 's automatic coffe makers use 5 ounces as a cup . They used to use 6 ounces when they told us the pot capacity . But , I suppose one manufacturer advertised greater capacity in cups using the smaller definition so they all followed the leader to remain falsely competitive. < br /> To make a full pot ( 50 ) oz . ( 10-5 oz cups ) It would take a little more than 2 grinds unless the cup is overfilled . Like other blade grinders when over filled , you could get powder on the bottom and large chunks at the top. < br /> I grind enough beans for about a week of full auto pots . The ground coffee goes into a sealed container . I can detect a taste difference between the first pot I make and the last . If I did , I wound store the sealed container in the fridge , which is where coffee should be kept ground or whole. < br /> So this little chopper , is restricted to grinding spices and I will buy some other grinder for coffee . So far it ground cumin seeds and mustard seeds and did a good job at that . But do n't call it a coffee grinder unless you do n't like coffee which I have been drinking black for 48 years .#### #### ####[([134], [127], 'NEU'), ([183], [188], 'NEU'), ([146], [145], 'NEU')]

I was looking for a means of straining the guava pulp when making jelly , which we send to friends and family at Christmas . Our one guava tree will produce 140-160 jars of jelly , so efficiency is important to me . I saw this bag and thought it would do the trick better than plain cheesecloth and have been delighted with it . It lets all the juice through , but none of the pulp or seeds . It is also strong enough to be able to squeeze the pulp to get all the juice out . Our straining per batch has gone down from 4 strains to 2 and the second strain is actually unnecessary . It gets it all the first time . I love this bag and will probably order another one to have on hand . It does the job perfectly , is easy to clean and makes the entire process easier . One thing I would like to see is a larger width , maybe 14-15 inches to fit around the top of the pan . Overall , a magnificent straining bag .#### #### ####[([160], [157], 'POS'), ([125], [117], 'POS'), ([78], [83], 'POS'), ([156], [149], 'POS'), ([114], [113], 'POS')]

This is a really great sized grill for large groups . It can be used both indoors or out , but given that it is electric , I do n't think it would be safe to leave outside while not in use . Things to be aware of : the grill surface does tilt down to a drip pan , but this does not have a top plate like traditional Foreman grills , so you will have to flip your items over . ( And the grill time will be longer . ) The plates do not detach , so they cannot go through the dishwasher . This can be used on the base for outdoors , or without it for countertop use . All in all , versatile and great for large group grilling . A bit much for small apartments .#### #### ####[([67], [66], 'POS'), ([134], [138], 'POS'), ([50], [46], 'POS')]

This Aroma stainless steel rice cooker has replaced the crock pot as my favorite appliance in the kitchen ! The stainless steel bowl has a heavy-duty feel to it . It actually pays to go with the stainless steel because besides the health benefits of NOT cooking with aluminum or Teflon , the stainless steel bowl lasts a lot longer also . Our Aroma rice cooker is not limited to just rice . We cook all types of grains as well , such as millet and quinoa . Get the steamer accessory as well to turn this appliance into a one meal wonder . I use it to steam frozen chicken breasts and frozen vegetables from the freezer above my rice or grain in the bottom pot. < br /> The steel bowl may develop a cloudy white film over time . I use just enough white vinegar during cleaning to cover the bottom of the bowl . in five minutes or less the bowl wipes clean . You wo n't have to do this often . Our rice cooker gets used with almost every meal , and we 've owned it for over 5 years now . It 's beginning to show wear . We 're very satisfied with this product .#### #### ####[([211], [208], 'POS'), ([54], [53], 'POS')]

These are my first bamboo cutting boards I have ever owned . I worked as a professional cook for many years and the cutting boards is the second most common tool used by professionals ( the first of course , being the knife ) . If you have fine knives you need an exceptional cutting board to maintain the sharpness and quality of the blade . These cutting boards exceed the standards . I especially like that you get 3 matching cutting boards so that you can keep your produce and meat cutting on completely separate surfaces. < br />< br /> Bamboo is a renewable resource . I like that this product is n't a huge chunk of plastic or that a forest had to be mowed down to make this . Some bamboo species grow up to a foot per DAY and it makes one of the most environmentally responsible materials to build things out of . I found a coupon code for this product on the internet that got me a small discount on the price and they requested ( but not required ) that I would leave a review whether it was good or bad . I would buy this product again even without the discount because I was searching for this new cutting boards anyways .#### #### ####[([123], [116], 'POS')]

Our filter got totally clogged and I found a way to clean it . Get Dishwasher detergent powder not liquid and add to boiling water . Submerse the filter in it and continue to boil , the water will turn brown . I boiled for about 5 minutes but it has taken 4 times to clean it . At first the filter was opaque when held to the sun but then clear spots appear and finally it is all clear . It really works again . BakeitFun Silicone Baking Mat with Measurements , Heat Resistant , Reusable , Non-Stick , Half Sheet 16-1 / 2 x 11-Inch , Raspberry Red + Digital Cookbook < br />< br /> I currently line my half-sheet with a Silpat mat . I was interested in trying this BakeitFun mat to compare it . The first thing I noticed is the cookie grid versus no real markings other than the name Silpat and that it ’s made in France . So , BakeitFun , I do not know and I cannot find where this product is made . I will assume China until officially told otherwise . I looked at the website and of course the packaging . This is the first cooking product that keeps its manufacturing location a secret . Why ? This disturbs me enough to dock one star . I followed the directions and washed and oiled the mat before using it. < br />< br /> This would be a five star product if I did n’t have to wonder where it was made . It performed extremely well in my Nestle cookie test . I ’m not a great baker but I know how to bake frozen cookie dough into cookies . I set my dough clumps in the designated circles and placed them in my preheated oven . I ’m uploading some pictures of my session . I have to bake them a few minutes longer then the instructions as my oven is showing its age . It still works and mostly I adjust to it . They came out golden perfection and slipped right off the mat and onto my cooling rack . After a good rest I ate a couple and they were as good as I could expect . Slightly crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside . Excellent result using this mat . I am very happy with the mat and will raise to five stars if a company rep replies to this post with the country of manufacture and answers why it ’s nowhere to be found. < br />< br /> UPDATE : 8 / 31 / 15 < br /> Thanks to the BakeitFun Team we now know that the mat is manufactured in China in an FDA approved plant . The packaging is also being updated to show the country of origin. < br />< br /> This product was provided at or nearly no cost for the purpose of evaluation and review .#### #### ####[([36], [44], 'POS'), ([195], [194], 'POS'), ([203], [194], 'POS'), ([188], [194], 'POS')]

We drink a lot of wine in my home , and at one time had over 1000 bottles in our cellar . As you can imagine , we 've used almost every variety of bottle opener there is , from a simple corkscrew to the most innovative CO2 pressure models . Now I readily admit that I have almost zero skills with a classic waiter 's corkscrew . My favorite opener for years was the 2-prong Butler 's Friend . It was almost foolproof , but it took some strength and skill to use well . Since the introduction of the first &# 34 ; rabbit &# 34 ; style openers , I 've never gone back to the Butler 's Friend . A few years ago we bought our first lever-pull opener , very similar to the Peak Reserve . I loved it and have n't used anything else since . It 's simply the easiest style of opener to use , bar none. < br />< br /> Loving my all-stainless lever-pull as I do , I was a little uncertain that I 'd like the Peak Reserve opener more . After all , my original is all stainless and bullet-proof . After quickly and easily opening a bottle last night , I fell hard for the Peak Reserve and banished my old stainless love to the back of the drawer . This opener has an easy-to-hold sueded grip . In addition , both the squeeze lever and the pull lever are beautiful brushed stainless , giving a softer , more elegant look and better grip than my bright stainless opener . The squeeze lever is substantial and wider than my old model , with a flare that provides a nice surface for squeezing the lever . The pull lever , used to lift the cork cleanly from the bottle , is also wider and flatter than on my old model . The cork on last night 's bottle came out quickly and cleanly , as expected with a good quality lever-pull opener. < br />< br /> To complete the picture of a quality item , the Peak Reserve opener comes in a very handsome black case , nestled deep in black felted foam shaped to fit the opener and the included 4-wheel foil cutter . This is tailor-made for elegant gifting to your wine-loving friends and family . Note to Peak Reserve - please consider softer foam , the opener is held so tightly it 's almost too hard to remove it from it 's case. < br />< br /> If you 're one of those fortunate folks who can open a bottle with a waiter 's corkscrew in 5 seconds flat , good for you , but you should still consider the Peak Reserve because it 's easier to use and faster , too . For the other 90 % of wine lovers , this was made with you in mind . It 's faster and easier than any butterfly or rabbit opener you 've ever used and it 's more comfortable to hold than the extra-heavy all-stainless lever pulls . I highly recommend it. < br />< br />** Peak Reserve provided a sample opener to me with no obligation. ** r is held so tightly it 's almost too hard to remove it from it 's case . After a few months of maybe once-a-day usage , the timer broke ; it could only go on ( by turning the timer to a time ) or off ( by moving it back to 0 ) . A couple months later , the ability to turn the oven off broke , so it had to be turned off by unplugging it . A couple months later , it broke entirely , and could not be turned on at all. < br />< br /> Also , the numbers wore out almost immediately ; on the first day , they had already started to smudge . It appears that the ink on the knobs for this oven is not made to be touched , heated , or both -- which is unfortunate given that those are their basic tasks . It probably saved the company like $ 0.10 to use the cheaper ink though ... so ... good for them. < br />< br /> It 's not a bad piece of equipment : for $ 120 , I got a year 's worth of baking . But between the terrible ink , the broken timer , and other reviewers' reports of fires or exploding glass. . maybe give this one a pass , get a $ 250 one , have it last you like 5 + years instead of a few months .#### #### ####[([7], [2], 'NEG'), ([3], [2], 'NEG'), ([138], [137], 'NEG')]
